text: We ordered from the Vegan menu. Yes they have special Vegan menu. We ordered roti with green curry it came with bowl of rice. It was delicious roti was crisp. Next we ordered pad Thai noodles with vegan sauce. The noodles were little oily but the taste was very good. There was no room for desserts but we inquired and they have or can make 3 out of 5 desserts vegan. Something for next  Time.

I love Thai food and when I find one, I would definitely recommend and write the review for it.  The food is so delicious and very tasty.  I also like the decoration style of the restaurant, very warming.

We lived in Thailand and got addicted to Thai cuisine. Finally, we found a perfect Thai restaurant in Las Vegas! Real Thai food, nice atmosphere, amazing service. Definitely will come again and again.

I stop by today for lunch their menu is an interesting offered between 11-3pm and the prices are under$10 for the 18 different lunch listed.serve with viggie or egg drop soup rice and salad and having vegan option!!! Service was great everyone was really friendly and welcome and helpful they explained to me very clearly.i had E-San set it's was awesome the set come with BBQ chicken Salad Sticky rice and papaya salad
I'm very happy eating ;)..I will definetely recommend this restaurant
Just ate here for the first time,an all I can say is if you're vegan or vegetarian.... This is the place to go for Thai food....not enough stars to rate this place!;

This place is a hidden gem. The service is excellent and food tastes amazing. They have a great lunch menu that includes dumpling soup and a salad. The dumpling is amazing. I highly recommend this place for lunch. Most items on lunch menu are between $7-$9.
Love this place...food are amazing. I had the hot & spicy basil spaghetti..it's gonna be my favorite one   :)) inside the restaurant is very pretty. Love the decoration

Fantastic Little Thai restaurant. Really nice modern clean decor and super friendly people. Food was extremely good and their spiciness level was very thorough. Portion sizes we're fairly large and prices were excellent in the $10 to $12 range for entrees. Everyone in my group will definitely be going back.

Phenomenal Restaurant! We were lucky to have met the owners and the couple were extremely nice. The food was amazing and the customer was excellent. I would definitely recommend to anyone to is craving Thai Food!
Amazing place, great food! Definitely try if you're near that area. Their spicy eggplant is awesome!! Best I've ever had and their soups are delicious.
Friendly staff, good quality food, overall fantastic value for your money. Try the spicy eggplant grilled; you won't be disappointed!

This place is enthusiastically getting an upgrade to 5 stars.  The food and service is consistently outstanding and the pricing makes it a great value.  This place has become a regular favorite for my wife and I.

The Salmon with Mango Salsa and Panang Curry are two of my favorites.

It is very unfortunate that I have to change my review from a 4 star to 1 star. When we first tried this place out, we were in love. They have the best spring rolls I've tried throughout town, and our server was very sweet. After the past two experiences I have had there, it pains me to say that I'll never come back.

Food - still good. It's nice that they add a separate vegan section to their menu, and the spicy herb bed tofu was very different and flavorful, but when I order a 5 out of 5 and was able to eat it with no rice and taking only a few sips of water, I'm not trying to be a badass. You are doing something wrong. However, as far as flavor goes, it is very yummy here.

Service - This is the entire reason we will not come back. One of the servers there, whose name I can't remember, and I am sorry for that, is awesome. She's shorter than the other servers that I have seen there. She works very hard for her guests and has a very friendly, open attitude.

The other servers are horrible, all of them. Their hours are posted as closing at midnight, but if you show up at 11:20pm, they announce that they're already closed, will seat you begrudgingly, make you order before youre even sested, toss your food onto the table, and rush you out of the door. It is a horrible experience for someone who walked in 40 minutes before they close. Not 10 or 5 minutes. 40, and we were one if four tables in there.

But every restaurant gets a second chance rule, which is why we came back. We had our awesome server, and the only complaint was the food, until right before we left. My friend had walked up to our server to hand her a cash tip, and another server interrupted her and snatched her cash out of her hands. Look, I am a server. I know how things work behind the scenes. I can spot which servers actually care and which servers are low and sheisty. She, who was the same server that rushed us before, was sheisty. She didn't even serve us and yet she still grabbed, actually snatched it from my friends hand, a tip from another table? Argue that they may split tips, it is still very, very rude how she handled the situation. As a regular customer, I don't think I've ever felt so uncomfortable and unappreciated.

Thai table lost 4 customers who used to dine there weekly. I would suggest looking up Komol for a more authentic, spicy, innovative thai food experience with friendly service.
very good ! , very friendly , polite,excellent take-out Thai food. I had the pumpkin curry and the pad see ew noodles with beef both were excellent !! good food !!!

Me and my husband were super hungry and we saw this restaurant in the middle of our way to our hotel. This place has a great Chi and it's very relaxing and nice.
Decoration is great. I ordered Tom Yum soup and so far, it is the best Tom Yum I had in Vegas. ( Im the Tom Yum Pro). My husband ordered shrimp fried rice and Thai Iced tea which was Delicious. I ordered Lamb shoulder and greens ...YUUUUM. and dessert,,,,,shortcake and strawberry. I definitely revisit this restaurant. The server was sooooo sweat and helpful.

The best Thai food I have had in Vegas.  The wonton soup is freaking awesome and the Prime Rib w/ chili sauce is pure meat perfection!  I've ordered 3 times this week!  Especially compared to some other Thai fast food places, this place is the bomb!
Great food and nice decor. Close to the airport easy to find and the staff was very friendly and helpful. What more could want?

We were going to the coffee shop next door, but decided to get lunch here first. We started reading the menu outside on the sidewalk, and the waitress popped her head out to make sure we didn't have any questions. We noticed they had many vegan options, so we went inside. The inside is very nice and cozy, with a romantic ambience and very clean. Perfect for a date night. The waitress was very nice. I ordered the vegan orange tofu, which was wonderfully presented. Portion size was bigger than I expected for the lunch price, and came with rice, side salad, and a broth soup with veggies. The orange tofu was delicious. Actually, everything was. Our waitress checked on us often, and gave us recommendations for vegan entrees to try next. We will definitely be back.

First time here and I was really impressed! Lipi and Patty waited on us and they were both an absolute pleasure. They helped us choose an appetizer and an entree. The food was very delicious and not too heavy. I've never had such personal service. I will definitely be back!!

Friendly service. Excellent food choices. Today for lunch I enjoyed the red curry chicken with brown rice soup and salad all for under $10.00.
Clean establishment. Fresh food.
What more can u ask for in a restaurant.

I am a HUGE thai foodie. With that being said, I found Table Thai through Yelp, quickly placed an order for delivery and was very satisfied with what I got! Upon arrival the food was still warm as if it had come straight from the kitchen onto my dinner table. The driver was very nice and even gave me some free thai iced tea for ordering delivery. 

Food:

- The first thing i got was a yellow curry. For the price it was a bit small portioned but really satisfied my hunger. The sauce was excellent and had a bit of a kick to it (i got a medium) and had a VERY generous amount of meat in it. The flavor was excellent as well as the consistency; not too runny, not to thick. This came with your choice of white or brown rice. 

-Second, I ordered the pad thai. Once again this was on a scale from not spicy-spicy. I got a medium but the flavor was not spicy at all. Anyways, the noodle were very flavorful and all around good. They came with chicken, bean sprouts, green onion, egg, a lemon, and peanut topping.  

-Thai Iced Coffee. Enough said. It was absolutely amazing. 

-Thai Iced Tea: Simply amazing. Wow.

Overall, this was the best delivery thai I've had. 5/5 would order from here again.

Oh my goodness gracious! Phenomenal! Absolutely the best thai I have ever tasted! I cannot talk more highly about this place! Do not give reviews often but when it is this good I must! Not one complaint- perfection- I suggest the pineapple curry duck and the lagoons also the spices are very authentic to levels of spiciness! My business partners and I go atleast one a week now and it's been great every time!

This was the worst Thai food I've ever had. The chicken was not cooked fully and not cut up ( it was served as a very large piece in the curry ). I feel sick after eating it. I also got pad Thai which was dry and lacking flavor. I will never order from this place again.

Genuinely my favorite Thai spot in town! If you don't want to wait in impossible lines for Lotus, you won't be disappointed in Table Thai's food. Tip: ask for a coconut when you sit down, you'll be happy drinking coconut water out of a coconut - then eating the meat from the inside with a spoon! (Ask them to shave the sides for you though, as sometimes they don't. Unless you're up for a challenge with your meal.) the menu features veg and vegan options, (ask if other things can be made vegan, my favorite is Tom Kha  Kai as spicy as possible with tofu made vegan.) there are special plates/boxes, and as always, if you've never had one - you MUST get a Thai Ice Tea (only if you have a sweet tooth though.) You won't be disappointed. :)

If I could give a split rating I would. I actually give this place five stars for the quality and taste of the food which is wonderful but only three stars and that customer service is not all that great. sometimes we are looking for a wonderful place to eat and don't care about service but service does make the meal and unfortunately the service here is not all that great. The food absolutely amazing
Needed some nice spice tonight. After reading reviews chose here. Glad I did. Great food, friendly staff. Will be back and highly recommend
As a Thai-American I can say this is truly authentic Thai that everyone will love. It's our favorite Green Valley Thai place.
Try to have a lunch before heading to airport.. small but busy restaurant.. Also good and tasty foods... Service also good too.

While small and cute, i have to say the food was far from good.  The intro soup was cooked with frozen peas and carrots.  The chicken mint was too oily and had a "fast food" taste.  No unity with the severs and staff.  All over the place.  Sorry but I will not be back.
We love this place! So excited they have a vegan menu. The vegan curry is amazing!  Nice atmosphere and great customer service :)

We have eaten here before and the food was good, however not so on 12/7/16. The staff is friendly , but the cook is slow. We ordered Tom yum soup that was so overpowered by lemongrass that it was inedible. 
Also the drunken noodles tasted ok , but were swimming in oil. The best thing was the pineapple fried rice which was average.
This is not the worst Thai place I've eaten at , but I see no reason to return
Amazing food & service! The crab fried rice & BBQ pork were my favorite! Chicken panang & pad thai also very good.

The server forgot our app, did not inform us of an added ingredients even when a
we asked her to clarify what was in the dish. Basically we had one entree which we split, a forgotten appetizer and an incorrect order which eventually was corrected. Thankfully we were not on a lunch break and could afford to wait. The food was ok, We are still looking for a good Thai place on this side of town. Weera is good but somewhat Americanized and less traditional.

This is my favorite thai place in east las vegas Thank you for always serving fresh delicious food. My absolute favorite is the basil hot an spicy rice its perfection. The orange chicken and chicken say are now my new favorites. Adding wonton soup today. I cant wait!!!
Great food! Loved the curry puff starter dish & very nice interior decorations! The food was great & there Thai iced tea was amazing. I also Love that they have a vegan menu as well !

The pad Thai was bland and very greasy. The chicken in both the pad Thai and basil chicken were gamey as if they had been reheated as opposed to freshly cooked. Very disappointed with the quality and quantity for the price. The staff was very friendly though. We won't be back.
Best Thai food after Lemon Grass and Lucky's Thai food. It's on our monthly list from now on.

For as many Thai food places as there seem to be, it's hard to find good Thai food.  We'd driven by this place a few times and decided to stop in for a nice dinner out.

The decor is pleasing and the dim lighting makes it feel intimate.  It's a little thrown off by the giant TV mounted in the corner, but I know some people need that during their meal.  We got seated next to a decorative barrel, which I ended up bashing my elbow on several times.  I'm not an enormously tall guy, but the seating arrangement next to the decor was not doing me any favors.

The service was not promising at first.  There was one waitress for the entire restaurant and she was dedicating all of her time to the large party sitting a table over.  Once the other girl came over to help us, service improved.

My wife ordered the Spicy Basil with Tofu, which they unfortunately made with chicken.  Not wanting to be wasteful, she ate it anyway, because she would feel worse about the chicken going into the trash.  It had a good flavor, though not the best Spicy Basil we've ever had.  She also got the Tom Kha soup, which was super yummy.

I got the Crying Tiger.  The sauce was flavorful, though the meal felt like it was missing something.  It was just a bit too much "here's some meat, enjoy!"

It wasn't a perfect meal but it was promising enough that we'll be back.
This place has incredible customer service and fantastic food! Always here sooner that expected and always fresh!
We had the spicy basil and the garlic and pepper, both were excellent. The service here is awesome and prices are very reasonable. Highly recommend this Thai restaurant.
Best Thai food I've ever had! They have such a unique menu and the service is absolutely wonderful here every time. I love love love the cute atmosphere in here too!
I always order delivery from this place and they always get my order right even with substitutions, the food here is sooo good and arrives in a timely manner!

I like trying new places to eat and thought from the reviews that this place would be good. How wrong I was. I usually give people the benefit of the doubt, but I will not be giving this place another chance. The food, at best, was mediocre. Maybe I didn't get their specialties. But that wasn't the main issue. I made my order for delivery around 6:00 PM last night. An hour later the delivery lady calls and says she can't find our location. I couldn't understand her because her accent was so bad.

My daughter had to talk to her and finally got her pointed in the right direction. Well over an hour has now passed and she finally gets here with the food. No apologie, the food is cold and she has the gall to blame us for not giving her the right address. What is Google maps for? Needless to say I won't be eating here ever again.

Ehr Mah Gerd  this place is awesome!!!  Thick accent from our waitress= authentic Thai?  It wasn't just good, it shakes a stick at being the Best!  You know that feeling when you don't know whether you want to eat the food or make love to it??? Yeah, it was like that.  We had the shumai, pad Thai, and the pad see oooooh yeahhhhh! Best pad see ew I think I've ever come across.

Updated Review: I've been frequenting Table Thai every week since my first review, and I'm consistently so impressed! Fresh, delicious flavors, great portions and great prices. My favorite Thai restaurant by far!
This place is awesome! Great vegan options too! Amazing service!! Server Patty is fantastic!

Wow. This was a drive from our house, but we saw many great reviews and boy was it worth it. First, although the inside isn't huge, it is very comfortable and inviting. We started out with the Shu Mai appetizer, followed by the Tom Kha soup for my wife and the beef Prik King for me. The food was all supurb and even though Table Thai is about a 30 minute drive, it is now our favorite Thai restaurant and we will definitely be going back often.

Went back for a 2nd try and had the Drunken Noodles which were wonderful. The wife tried the Lamb luncheon special that I had tried last time. I want to try various other dishes, but the Lamb dish is so savory that the taste just stays in the brain as a most wondereous thing. Every once in a while in your lifetime you come across a restaurant where the chef really knows what he is doing and creates recipies that surpass all other chefs.
Simply put, the service is as good as the food.   A++ all around!  The food is some of the best Thai I have had In all my travels.  Will definitely  return.
Amazing food! And great service! It will look like a shady place from out but its actually a fine dining place once you are in. Love it would definitely visit when in Vegas again!
Go for a terrific weekday lunch- affordable, delicious, and thoughtfully presented. The restaurant is a small space, but there's never a wait or line, and the friendly staff is attentive.

This place has amazing food and amazing staff. they are really sweet and care about their food and customer service. The restaurant itself is nice and relaxing and the food was better than I expected it to be. One of the best Thai restaurants in Vegas for me, I've been looking forever for good Thai food In Vegas and finally found it. Happy I gave this place a try.

I eat at table thai for lunch. It's busy, but it's good value. Dinner on the other hand is a joke. 1st time there appetizers were served with the main course. The 2nd time, I specifically requested the table I wanted to be seated at. When I arrived for my reservation there were 2 other couples there, and they had given my requested table away ! Even worse, the manager was so loud that those people got up and moved. I was totally embarrassed. 
I will never go back there again.
There are 3 or more other thai restaurants within 2 miles, and I'll just go to them
Good food, Good service, and reasonable prices. I like this place better than some more fancy and expensive restaurants.
I'm so stoked my sister and I came in here- 10/10 would recommend! Great prep, atmosphere, and service. We split Tom Kha soup and orange chicken, both of which were fantastic and so well made.

Ordered take out from Table Thai this evening because I wasn't sure what the restaurant looked like inside; mall location, dark, etc.. I was pleasantly surprised to see that this location is very nice, clean and refreshing.

The host immediately greeted me and got me my order, then offered me a cold beverage as I waited. I had the Panang Curry-Chicken with the Thai Basil Fired Rice.  Both dishes were incredibly delicious and next time I will be sure to dine inside.
Such a great spot! Nice, dark atmosphere and wonderful service. Try the spicy seafood soup!

I have passed by this place several times and never thought to try until today. My sister suggested it because they offer vegan options. They offer a full vegan menu and even gave us free soup and drinks. Will definitely be coming back.

I'm proud to add my voice to the chorus of love for this place.  We stumbled on Table Thai Bar & Bistro (TTBB) on a delivery site I will not name because they serviced our neighborhood. I hadn't realized I had had visited and thoroughly enjoyed TTBB before. I've stumbled on this place two times now and been pleased both time.

Everything we ordered was delicious. While there is a great deal of Thai food in Vegas, what I haven't seen much, is a eye toward vegan options. That's why we chose TTBB and that is why we will continue to come back. They dedicate a sizable portion of their menu to vegan fare--but it gets even better. From what I saw, many of the noodle dishes can include "soy chicken", "soy beef", or tofu. For those of us looking to reduce/eliminate animal protein in our diets, having proteins that extend beyond tofu is exciting.  And yes, I know that soy options may not be "healthy", but they provide plant-based eaters options when dining out.

We ate the gyoza, fresh rolls, pad see eiw, pad thai, and yellow curry. While I didn't love the texture of the noodles in the pad see eiw, I know that the noodles did not get a fair chance to impress us after traveling across town in a delivery car. The large chunks of carrot inthe curry were a little daunting, but after tasting the flavor of the curry I let my concerns go. 

This is a place to add to your regular rotation--I know I've added it to mine.

This is restaurant is starting to grow on me. There are so many Thai choices in Vegas and this is becoming my favorite go to place for Thai food. 

Food: chicken Satay meat super tender and grilled to perfection. Tom Yum soup just the right amount of spice and flavor. Yellow curry my favorite curry goes so well with my rice it is addicting and finally the spicy basil ground chicken is the best around and I ate at many many Thai around town

Service: I was greeted warmly and treated very well. Can't ask anything more from the servers. Top notch

Great place great food. Warm people

My experience at Table Thai was amazing. Not only was the food delicious, but the staff was beyond friendly and accommodating. For appetizers we had the dumplings (I forgot the actual name) but they were SO yummy. We also had the chicken satay, which were just OK in my opinion. For entrees, my friend and I both had the lunch specials and the chicken curry and pad Thai were both very satisfying and the prices were great. The spice level is also adjusted to your preference which was also great. We ended our meal with the Thai tea crepe cake which is a definite must try! Overall, this is a great restaurant and I will definitely be back to try some more of their great menu items:)
Pretty tasty, and they deliver! The people that work here are the absolute nicest, we have only gotten delivery, but they are so friendly and remember us.

First off I ordered food through the eat 24 app. It was quite convenient. 

As for the food, I got the wrong soup. I ordered the Tom kha and got something else. I called to let them know and they informed me they'd resolve it by refunding me the money,  but I never got it. 

The orange chicken was not good. The chicken was thinly sliced and battered but not saucy or crunchy. It could be because I had it delivered so it had time to get soggy. The chicken is fried and served with a side of orangey dipping sauce.  Not great.  

I do plan on ordering from there again because it's convenient and I believed in giving a place more than one chance. Hopefully the next one will be better

Excellent place . I lived in Thailand for many years and they just have the authentic curry  . My favourite is the soft shell crab panaeng curry , sticky rice with mango is delicious too. Service is always excellent . Friendly staff and a great find Indeed
Me and my friend had a absolutely great time in this place. Very quiet and romantic dinner place. And we had a great talk with the girl Lipi who work here.
Their green curry with roti is ####ing amazing, and not to mention they have a whole vegan section of the menu. Awesome restaurant, amazing staff, delicious food.

Staff are all very welcoming, attentive and friendly (I was simultaneously greeted by 3 busy servers as I walked in) - I love how they all seem to work so well together. The restaurant is beautifully decorated and flows well. My to-go order (shrimp pad thai) was awesome and served up promptly. I would absolutely recommend this restaurant!

If they can make takeout taste incredible it must be a great place! Every "option" I added was carefully assessed and the food was perfect. I can't ever seem to find a Thai place that gets the curry as hot as I like... perfection! The pho is incredible too! Definitely recommend!

Was probably the most amazing Thai food delivery I have EVER had.
We had crag langoon, orange chicken, chicken satay sticks, drunken noodle & curry. Everything was exceptional & all arrived crisp & fresh!
Will definitely be ordering from them again & excited to go to the restaurant too!

This is a great neighborhood place to get authentic Thai food. 

When we come here, we can always count on the following: Great options, delicious (and large) Thai tea, CLEAN environment and great service. 

You never have to wonder where your servers are, as they are politely attentive. As for the food, the quality of the meat is important to me and they meet my standards! No rubbery-ness that you find at some other Asian restaurants.

We have tried most of their curries, and many of their noodle dishes, but the pineapple/shrimp curry (if I'm not mistaken) is my favorite.

Also, they deliver and it's just as good at home!

I would say this place isn't good for groups larger than 6, as the setting is a little more intimate so space would be an issue. Great date night place, though!

Casual & cute restaurant hidden in a small strip mall off Sunset. My date and I stopped here on our way to Galaxy Theatre, only ~2 miles away. It was conveniently located and also oh so tasty. The staff are extremely friendly and attentive. I had the Pumpkin Shrimp Curry and it was great! My date had the Drunken Noodles and that was also delicious. My favorite part may have been the Thai Tea and Thai Coffee though.  Strong and sweet and delicious. We will definitely be coming back AND ordering delivery!
Great service, beautiful presentation, delicious flavors, welcoming intimate atmosphere, vegan food.... Can't get much better!

This is a really cool spot. Service was really nice and quick. Nice ambiance.  Table settings and decor looks nice for any occasion or dinner events. Ordered the panang beef, garlic lamb chop, crab fried rice, drunken noodle, namtok pork, and for dessert my favorite mango sticky rice and coconut ice cream. Yeah, I was hungry! We liked everything. I would definitely come here again.

Ordered a few items for pick up. Once I had picked up my entrees and drove all the way home I noticed the bag leaking. When I checked my entrees the entire bag was filled with my pho soup that I had ordered. Whoever packaged the meal put my soup into a cracked to-go-bowl. My soup was now completely drained into the bag and it ruined the rest of my entrees as well as the seat in my car. I will never be ordering from here again.
The best , very good and service excellent. Better than (Archies). And service very good. Patty spectacular..

I went there for my early birthday dinner with my husband and my baby . I love the restaurant decoration and the server treat me like we are super VIP person . We ordered shumai and dipped with thai authentic sauce . And we surprised we love their Lamb Panang. And we ordered a lot of food and we love it all
Yum! Great food, friendly service, and nice atmosphere. Prices are very reasonable. We'll be back! Good drunken noodles and cashew chicken. Fresh roles weren't my favorite.

Great lunch spot for dining in or take out. Gets pretty busy between 12-1pm but it moves very fast. Servers are welcoming and friendly. The Thai Tea is the best I've ever had. All lunch specials are from $8-$11 and they include a soup and salad. My favorite is the orange chicken. It's perfectly crunchy with a sweet orange sauce. Best orange chicken I've ever had. If you like like Thai- you have to try this place!

Hands down the BEST Thai food in Vegas! I eat from here at least weekly and it never gets old. Funny thing is that I never eat at the restaurant. Only once. Enjoyed it there but the delivery is quick and the food always comes hot and delicious! Friendly staff. They always remember me when I call. The to go presentation is awesome. Good quality containers that can be saved for Tupperware. Ok now for the food.

Panang chicken is the absolute best. Pineapple fried rice and drunken noodle is also good. The chicken is very good quality and super tender.  

Do yourself a favor and check this place out. It's my new favorite spot :) I love you table Thai

My girlfriend and I usually do delivery orders here when we're too lazy to go out(she's lazy to cook :) ) but this place doesn't disappoint! One of my favorite thai foods to eat around the neighborhood.

Came here for the first time with a friend for lunch the other day, forgot to put in the review, but I would definitely recommend eating here. Place was very clean and modern/fancy, and prices are affordable. Service was on point and welcoming. I ordered the yellow curry, which was delish, and mango sticky rice for dessert. Amazing, everything was amazing. I will be coming back here soon for more!!

This place was AWESOME BOOTS!!!! My cousin got off the plane at 10pm and he's a Vegan and had found this restaurant via a Google search. 

He had pharam long song soy (soy chickens) and papaya roll. 

I had the Kung Pao chicken. 

The food was soooooo fresh and tasteful. I even tried his soy chicken and literally could not tell that it wasn't real chicken

The service was also GREAT!!! We will be back.

This place was awesome! We ordered for delivery an assortment of dishes including the Tom Kha soup, and hot basil fried rice, chicken satay, crab rangoons, and Thai tea to name a few. The food was perfection and the delivery service was even better (anytime I don't have to leave the house is great :)
I will definitely be ordering from Table Thai again!
Wow o wow! Their curry is amazing! The noodles are so delicious! The staff is wonderful! Definitely coming back as much as possible!

Stopped here for dinner after dropping my son off to rent a truck at Home Depot...I'm so glad I did. Tasteful modern decor and comfortable chairs told me this was a cut above the usual Thai strip mall venue.

The Tom Yum was easily the best I have had since visiting Bangkok back in the nineties. For an entree, I opted for Garlic Pepper Pork with carrots and onions. It was delicious, and it's mild sweetness cut the fire of the Tom Yum nicely. I'll be back with friends whenever I visit the east side of town.

Excellent, attentive service from my charming hostess as well. Thumbs up on all counts!

This place is f-ing amazing. The food made me so happy and gave me such a high that I know I will never forget about this experience. I can't wait till i go back. I know there is a God, because only a deity could create something as delicious and intoxicating as this food. I will be going to church tomorrow to thank Jesus almighty for Thai food from Table Thai to pray that I will eat more in the future of my life. God bless.

Such a beautiful setting inside.  I couldn't stay for lunch but I got a mango sticky rice dessert and Thai tea w boba to go.  They have a vegan menu.  The service was friendly and I loved it the minute I walked in.  Will come back with my family to dine.

Ana was a wonderful delightful  hostess , food was incredible out of this world. 

Yes we would come back again if in Vegas

The Thai samplers ( chicken satay, fried coconut shrimp, steamed shiumai ) with special sauce each was tasty and truly appetizing! Must try the lamb chop - doesnt have a gamy taste and its perfectly medium grilled. I have been exploring the best mango  sticky rice in most Thai restaurant in Las Vegas! By far, Table Thai created the best dessert in town. The sticky rice with sesame seed cooked in coconut milk blended with mango purée on top was too die for! The freshly ripe  mangoes with cherry on top compliments the authentic Thai dessert . I thought the good was great and affordable . Patty provided excellent service and great recommendations on the menu.

Shortly after moving to Vegas, I had a great dining experience when this space was Taiga- I was distraught when they closed. Luckily, Table Thai is the same great service, tasty food, and elegant decor. Either they're still affiliated with the same owners, or this location is just lucky. 

The DUCK ROLLS are a simple but tasty app, much preferred over the GREEN PAPAYA SALAD- menu said this came with shrimp, but the $9 price tag yielded only two, and I found the dish rather lackluster. Opted for the SPICY BASIL FRIED RICE with chicken, per other rave reviews and liked it- a 3 will get you good heat, and this contains an ample portion of protein. But the MANGO STICKY RICE was a winner for both flavor and presentation, featuring toasted sesame seeds that added a whole 'nother dimension to this classic dessert.

Service was ridiculously attentive, in the best possible way. Menu has well-priced lunch specials for those who work in the area, but the dinner specials make them stand out from other Thai options in the area. Props for offering lots of vegetarian and vegan dishes!
Truly great Thai food. I reccomend the catfish. Staff are very nice. A little pricy but that because im poor.. Well worth it anyway. Same quality as Lotus of Siam.

My family has been going here since they opened. Nothing has changed. Quality and presentation of food is even better. My son loves the chicken BBQ. My daughter enjoys the mixed veggies and meat of crab fried rice. My hubby loves all of their menu with shrimp on it. I'm enjoying my noodle dishes and dessert every time. My new favorite is their layered cake. It's almost like Lady M crepe cake if you had the chance to try that one.

What a nice place to enjoy good company and great food!  I'm not terribly adventurous when it comes to Asian cuisine. Not a big fan of spicy food or curry. However I do love noodles and rice dishes. We ordered the crab fried rice as our appetizer....it's actually a meal but sounded good at the time! It was delicious! I ordered pad see ew for my main.  Best ever, period. Had Thai iced coffee for the first time, so yummy.  Service was exceptional! Can't wait to return.

Seriously the best Thai food I've ever had! We are from LA and there is no shortage of good Thai food but will definitely come here every trip to Vegas from now on. Service, food, and people were all top notch!

I do not live in Las Vegas, but while here, visited this place 3 times. It's one of those places where you say, "Damn, I wish I had something like this where I live." Excellent quality, ambiance, price, and service.

I find most Thai restaurants to be just that - Thai restaurants. If you want Thai food, you go there. So, you'll accept mediocrity. This is NOT one of those places. 

Had so many things off the menu, and everything was excellent. Please support Table Thai. They're awesome.

Really liked this place. Came in with a group of 8 people & they were on top of everything making sure we were always filled with drinks. Staff was always very attentive & we never had to sit around for anything. We ordered several things off the menu (see photos) I specifically ordered the Silver Noodles which I hadn't had for ages. It was great. Also ordered the Thai Tea Crepe Cake for dessert & that was so yummy. Everyone in our group loved the place & all said we'd come back. Hopefully I can make it there someday for lunch & try their lunch specials.

We ordered four items off of their vegan menu and all four were phenomenal! The orange tofu was by far the fave, but the four seasons, spicy tofu and veggie tempura were all top notch too. Plus the staff was so kind and so friendly with our children. We will definitely be back for more!!! Everyone should eat here!
Great service and food. Clean and welcoming atmosphere. I have Pad See Ewe and Thai tea.
Great food excellent service, my Thai friend just order a bunch of different things and it was awesome. The waitress Jenny is so pretty there too!

I ordered delivery, and it was delivered faster than the ticket said. It was SUPER hot like it had just been cooked (which with delivery you never know what to expect after it sits in a car on the way over, lol). 

The egg rolls are bomb! I definitely suggest Table Thai Bar & Bistro! 

The menu offers a lot, and it isn't super expensive. I am for sure a return customer :)

Stopped in to try a new Thai place when I was next door at the Sunrise Café. I ordered take out chx pad see ewe with spice rating of 3. Got home and was pleasantly surprised that my order was in a plastic container rather than the traditional takeout box. My dish was tasty and fresh although I wished they used Gai-lan rather than broccoli. Anyways, I think I will try and dine in next time. The décor is pretty nice and classy for an Asian restaurant. May be a great place for a date night with my wonderful wife.

Food was delicious and quick. Great plate presentation and the environment want clean and modern. Small place but for a Tuesday afternoon it was busy. I had the Tom kha soup w shrimp it definitely hit the spot w it's coconut milk spicy broth. Go for a 3 spicy. Nice balance

So far so good. The dining area is really nice. The menu is pretty extensive and they have different duck dishes that sets this place apart from other Thai places in the area. 

Since I was at the coffee shop for a couple hours and it was already lunch time when we left there, decided to stop by and check out this place for their lunch specials.

Lunch plates are offered between 11-4pm and the prices are under $10 for the 18 different entrees listed. Comes with a clear broth soup with a dash of black pepper seasoning. Also choice of steam or brown rice. Nice that they don't up charge you for brown rice!  They had great entree choices but I chose my standby dish; Yellow Curry Tofu to see how it measures up to the other Thai places. Unfortunately it was just okay for me. I was a little bummed out. Oh well.  The seasonings were not present and the curry was weak IMO .  The rice though that accompanied my order was cooked perfectly and I ate that all.  And I normally don't finish my rice!  I am impressed that the lunch portions offered are a pretty good size for lunch meals.  More food than lunch plates offered in other places.

The menu is an interesting read. Thirsty Drink,(for drinks) Sweet Lover(aka desserts), Hot & Warm,( Spicy and Mild I think they meant)  but what's Health & Healthy? I do appreciate the menu is organized into sections which made it easy to read and quick enough to zero in to what you are hungry for.

Even though my order was messed up initially, service here is great! The staff is really nice and my orders came out pretty quickly. I DO look forward to coming back here again. When I have a bigger appetite I want to try out  one one of the duck dishes and some of the Chef Recommendations for dinner.

To start off I'll say that once I pulled up into the parking lot, the exterior of the restaurant already caught my attention. Stepping foot into Table Thai Bar & Bistro amazed me, the interior of the restaurant was an outstanding sight. It looked very modern and the decor and furniture tied in with the modern culture of today's society. When the waitress greeted us, she was very polite and our first impression of her already gave us the perception of great customer service. Our first dish was an appetizer, Shumai and Papaya Salad. It was very fresh and delightful. Our second dish was an entree, Grilled Lamb Panang. The lamb being cooked medium, made the meat very tender and moist. The panang sauce matched very well with the exquisite meat. Afterwards, we enjoyed the Deep Fried Fish with Red Chili Sauce. We thought everything was amazing but this dish caused me to be ecstatic. The flavors were so splendid and went together so strongly. The deep fried fish was boneless and the sauce was not too spicy; the basil had a strong dominant taste that tied everything together. Last, but not least, don't forget to order their homemade Thai Tea. The sweetness was perfected and the tea was very delicate, but bold. Unfortunately, we did not order dessert due to all the delicious food we had eaten, but hopefully you try their desserts because I don't doubt that it isn't as amazing as everything else. I could doubtlessly say that everything from their presentation to the actual meal, was stunning. Overall, I savored every bite on my plate and every sip being drank. I could easily say that I will definitely be back to Table Thai Bar & Bistro very soon.

I was recently staying in Vegas for a business trip, and was stuck at the Hampton Inn hotel (which apparently doesn't have any restaurants near it!). The front desk staff recommended delivery, and I discovered this delivery restaurant on Yelp. 

I ordered from Table Thai and got my food within 35-40 minutes (as promised). Overall, the food was very solid. In fact, I ordered twice from this restaurant during my 3 day staff, and was really impressed with the mango sticky rice (YUM!) and eggplant veggie stir fry. Overall, glad I found it as it was one of the few delivery places near my hotel!

This place has the BEST vegan food in town ( u must try roti with green curry and curry puff ) and many dishes are to die for. 
The atmosphere is awesome, comfy, relaxing and very nice. The staff is extremely sweet and attentive. Its perfect to giving 5 star
Food is good, but the service is so slow that we end up being an hour late back from lunch... every time we go there. Even when we show up at 11:30am. The kitchen seems to be slow.

Cashew Chicken. Tso good.
Lunch portion was perfect. 
Great soup and salad and salad dressing.
Great service with fresh excellent Thai cuisine.    Loved the Tom Ka soup.  Chicken Satay was OK.  Tiger steak YUM and shrimp fried rice had excellent flavor. I'll definately come back!

I ordered the Pad Thai with tofu for dinner which had a very good and traditional Thai flavor. It's so delicious. The atmosphere and service are great. The people are very friendly. They taking care of the customer. It's too cozy. The decor was a great creative and clean. It's awesome. Worth every cent.
Loved the food! We ordered for delivery and asked drunken noodles and Tom yum soup. It was delivered on time and the food was hot and really good!

The best Thai food on this side of town! I work very close by and so I take advantage of their lunch specials (sometimes 3x a week... take all my money!). I love the generous portion of entree vs. rice that they give. That's probably why I go there so frequently, and have gotten all my co-workers hooked to that place too. 

Still haven't tried a lot of the stuff on their menu, but I'm sure it's all good.

Table Thai and Bistro was a fast and easy delivery experience. I ordered the Spicy Basil Fried Rice, the Pepper & Garlic Chicken, Pad Thai and Spring Rolls. The rolls were fresh and crunchy and the spicy basil fried rice was to die for! The pad Thai was better than most places I've had and the pepper and garlic chicken was moist and delicious. The man that delivered our food was extremely friendly and personable. I will definitely order from Table Thai again!

There's nothing as pleasing as picking a restaurant at random and having it turn out to be some of the best food I've ever had! This is what happened last night when myself and two friends picked Table Thai and had a great meal. We went with the server's recommendation and couldn't have been more pleased. Everything we had was top notch and prepared to perfection! If you like Thai, you're gonna LOVE Table Thai!

What started off as a postmates order has now became my favorite local Thai spot. The food is great and the staff matches just that. Patty was amazing and made sure we were satisfied with everything we ordered and made us feel comfortable right away. I ordered the pad Thai level 4 which was pretty spicy but perfect for me, the fried wontons were SO GOOOD!, and the mango sticky rice was to die for. I'm more than satisfied with my overall experience here.
By far the best Thai!!!!!!! Ordered the green bean with chicken. Beware it has LOTS of garlic, but I loved it as I am infatuated with garlic. Also they have mango sticky rice year long!!!

My go-to Thai spot for sure. Conveniently located at the same plaza as Sunrise Coffee , right across Sunset Park.

Dark, dim interior - and open late. Prices for entrees/main courses are pricier than other Thai eateries , but I liked the ambiance and the way they cook the food here - so I didn't mind !

Food-wise , try the Crying Tiger or the Thai chicken bbq - my old-time favorite here is always the pad see ew. Their spice level is from 1 - 5. They have various hot sauces and peppers as well to give your meal that extra kick ! You have to ask for them though since they keep it in the back. They also have excellent dessert. They're the only place I know who serve Thai tea crepe cake , my favorite.

They have a menu for lunch specials from 11 am - 3 pm , cheaper and same portion amount.

Service is always great , the waitress was very kind and always checked on us to make sure we have enough water , (since we were probably sweating our eyes out). One night I was waiting for a to-go order , and one of the ladies gave me a free Thai iced tea while I waited which was very sweet of her :)
Tried on grub hub for the first time. .my order was ready on time and was very very flavorful.   Great menu and selection ....will be back for sure

Love coming here for their lunch specials. The shumai is to die for. What's amazing is their lunch special pricing. It's super cheap and comes with lots of stuff. I love cheap and this place will keep me coming back for more.

I order from this place at least two or three times a month everything I've ever gotten is hands down amazing good food! I've been in Vegas for three years now and surprisingly I've had a hard time finding genuinely great food here. Their pho rocks their vegetarian options are amazing my friend says The curry is legit great great place! I'm addicted to their garlic rice. My goal is to try everything on the menu.

This is a happening little restaurant. Modern and very cool dinning room. Vegan menu is a little small but grateful that they do have one. little pricy but not over the top. Food was very flavorful and service was on point. The sever had a huge section but she managed it very gracefully and my water was never empty. I would come here for an occasion or a date night rather than just grabbing a bite to eat.

Vegas cold nights makes me want soup and something good. Stumbled into this nice spot with the nicest staff. Great customer service, super friendly. 

Food was great! No complaints! My usuals for Thai food are always the soups and then pad Thai but here I got sold on the photo of their crying tiger cause I'm a meat eater and that was delish too. So far In Vegas I would have to say this place is one of my new favorites when it comes to Thai food! Definitely will be coming back and trying new things!
Pad Thai & Drunken Noodle take out. Flavor so-so, but display and package superb. It's harder to find good service than good food. Will return to try again.

I am giving 5 stars not just because the food was great (could maybe have had a spicier peanut sauce on the satay), but also because they were just a fantastic group of ladies running the place.  Very nice, modern interior, great "American" Thai food choices. I had Chicken Satay (generous, 5 skewers), Basil Chicken, standard Thai Iced Tea (again generous, big ol' Mason jar) with lastly Sweet Roti and Thai Tea Crepe Cake (apparently a family special).

Then when I asked for a taxi, instead they gave me a ride along since they were headed out to send a delivery.  Extremely nice, helpful, good food.  I would think if I were a local, I would be going here A LOT!
I usually order take out from him. It's always good, but every single time it tastes different. The most recent my pad thai was red more than orange. Always good, but just lacks a lot of consistency.
Cute little place to hang out.  Friendly & quick service. Foods are awesome.. We'll be back. Thanks Table Thai!!
Excellent food! Tons of flavor and at an excellent price. The service was really good as well. They have lunch specials and I really want to come back and try them! We will definitely be back!

I read the reviews, which were all good, and I couldn't agree more.  The duck roll appetizers were awesome. Fresh and tasty.  My wife says the Pad Thai was the best she's ever had. We also had the pineapple fried rice, it was great, and the yellow curry noodle. I'd probably not get the curry noodle again but not because the yellow curry wasn't good, because it was. It was very good.  But I prefer my curry sauce with rice. 
Anyhow, nice cozy small place, 2 televisions playing college football but with no sound so the nice jazzy music could still be heard. And the service was quick and friendly.

Visited on NYE. It seems to be in a commercial neighborhood, wasn't super crowded. The staff (Anna) was really attentive and gave great recommendations. We ordered a family size soup- simply yummy considering the weather outside was freezing; drunken noodles, papaya salad, spring rolls. Everything was really yum! Since we had a little more appetite we asked Anna to recommend something additional- she recommended the basil spaghetti but we wanted it with rice noodles instead. So requested that the chef get creative with rice noodles, basil and whatever else- the result was simply superb. Definitely recommend this and we plan to come back

I'm Lao & I have a hard time finding good, authentic Thai/Lao restaurants, but Table Thai is great! The staff is very friendly and professional. I truly love every item that I ordered. The shining stars are the pad thai and larb  I could eat them all day, everyday. The only thing I can criticize is the green papaya salad, but thats only because it's made Thai style & I prefer Lao style. Overall, I'll definitely be eating here regularly & recommending it to my friends!
Always good and consistent. I usually order off the lunch menu and it's plenty of food. I continue coming back to this place because it's reasonable and tastes great.

Very good food and service! The food came out exceptionally fast. Tried the Thai tea, crispy vegetable egg rolls, pad thai, and yellow curry. Don't forget to ask for spicy level 1 through 5. 1 is not spicy at all. Everything was great. Restaurant modern and clean. Very cozy.
Traveling for work and stopped at Table Thai- amazing meal. Had the spicy shrimp and mushroom spaghetti on the staff's recommendation and it was so good.

Great customer service. We ordered to go and the lady was all smiles and brought us water while we wait. We order crab rice ($16), pad Thai ($12) Tom ka (coconut soup)$6, crab rangoon. Over all good first time experience.

This place is great. Everyone is super friendly and accommodating, and the food is delicious. We go here once every 1-2 weeks.

Would always get the crispy spring rolls and the drunken noodles with soy chicken because they're the best things we've tried...until the other night. Tried the curry puffs and Pharam Long Song just recently and they're super tasty too (curry puffs are a touch pricey for the amount I feel, but they probably take a lot of work to make). Highly recommended!

They're also open later than pretty much every other Thai place, which is a HUGE plus as good late night spots are hard to come by.

Food was ok.  Ordered the lunch special spicy basil with ground chicken. It barely had any meat.  I told the waitress and she had just laughed. It was a tad too salty- which is rare for me in any case. The older waitress with the glasses was rude. I wanted utensils and asked nicely, she ignored me and then when I asked another waitress, she yelled out "I'm getting it already!" She looked so annoyed.  The only thing that was redeeming was the sticky rice and mango.  The best I've ever had, by far.

I've been here many times, and my experiences have always been positive. The food is always great, with strong flavors and a large variety of options, especially for my Vegetarian friends. Their Tom Yum soup is great, and I usually get the large for lunch and have the leftovers for dinner. There's also a great selection for lunch time specials. The only reason I have it at 4/5 stars is because the service is a bit slow, so you have to know beforehand to give enough time if you are eating lunch there. Definitely a repeat restaurant!

This place gets 5 stars for their amazing dishes and flavor. Really grate if you are a vegetarian. More so than other Thai places because of the soy chicken and soy beef. Lots of things to choose from but also my meat eater friends and family live it too. Love their curries, pad sew ew and pretty much everything on the menu I have tried.

We rolled into Las Vegas late one evening and our off-airport hotel directed us to a total dive bar for dinner and a drink. We thankfully kept driving and arrived here, where fresh-flavored Thai and excellent wine awaited. A great spot!

Staff was really friendly . I order Pad Thai ..It 's yummy . You can tell for spicy on the side . 
I would recommend this place for some good .
The food here is great .
Amazing Thai food in town . I will be back many time.

One of the best Thai food we had.  From the moment we walked in the service was awesome.   Highly recommend the Crab Fried Rice, Papaya salad and the Tom Yum hot and sour soup.  We received excellent service and most important the restaurant is so clean.  Very cozy place.  Will definitely come back.

Surprisingly exceeded my expectations. Tried coming here twice before with no luck; first time it seemed dead for a weekend so we were a bit skeptical and walked back out..second time the entire place was closed due to a private function...however, the 3rd time was a charm I guess. Had the usual Thai food; yellow curry, chicken pad Thai, fried rice, but something new...calamari and their crepe cake. Really, I just saw their crepe cake on Yelp and had to try it out! Each meal was very tastey! Be sure to add spice to it if you want some kick! Calamari was just right and their cake was delish! Wished I ordered ice cream on the side. Service was good, could use more than just one server. Seemed like the lady was running around doing everything from answering the phone, greeting, taking orders, serving and cleaning. She was very nice though. Ambiance was great! Clean and a nice zen feeling. Only draw back was they served the appetizer after our entrees came out. That's just a no no. But, I would come back for more!

After giving them a second chance now I have to give them 1 star.. First time I ordered for pick up the food was cold and had to reheat it.. Second time I made sure to mention that make sure my food is still hot. Got home food still hot BUT the rice that came with it was either old and sat in a rice cooker all day or it needed more water.. It was so hard that I couldn't even swallow it! Ruined my dinner for sure. Food is not good either.. Only reason I went back the second time was this was the only thai restaurant that's open late 11pm... It's very expensive here also.. I don't mind paying top dollar but the food has to be worth it but it's not! NEVER AGAIN!!!
Amazing food amazing service! Haven't tried anything I didn't love! Definitely my favorite Thai spot in Las Vegas!
Great service, great food.. My girl wasn't into Thai food, but after taking her here, she loves it.

Just not impressed.... I love to review restaurants when they are awesome, but I can't do that for this Thai place. My Pad see eww was mediocre at best. It had regular barely steamed broccoli compared to most that have Asian broccoli ... I asked for extra egg, noodle and sauce and all I got was more dry noodles and definitely not more egg.  My shrimp miso soup was flavorless with three pieces of shrimp that tasted straight out of the freezer :/ I chose this place due to Grubhub and delivery fee being low :/

After reading some good reviews and being recommended by a close friend, I decided to give Table Thai Bar & Bistro a try. I visited in a Sunday afternoon and the restaurant only serves dinner. The parking lot locates in front of the restaurant so just a few walks to the door. The front door is neat and clean with clear business hour on. Exotic decorations such as elephants which are the symbols of Thailand, Thai ladies wearing traditional dresses and some paintings show the culture and landscape of Thailand. The dining room was almost full by the time I arrived, I was surprised that most of the guests were with their families so I would say this is a kids-friendly restaurant or a perfect place to have family gatherings. There is not a full bar in the restaurant since the size of the restaurant is rather small but I noticed there is a long rectangular table in the middle can seat proximately 8-10 guests. 
 The restaurant only equipped with 2 servers that day so after it opened, guests arrived quite at the same time so we waited a good 10 minutes to get someone to order the food. I order the Lamb Panang curry because it's rare to see Thai restaurant serves lamb rack or lamb chop in curry sauce, compared to Indian cuisine. The presentation was excellent with a pinch of thai spice on the edge, and some lightly fried mint leaves underneath. I smelt coconut milk in the curry and the distinctively gamy smell of lamb. The spicy taste was on point and met my expectation with a slightly salty finish. My taste buds were covered by the pungent curry flavor and a naturally sweet coconut milk came afterwards. The lamb was cooked perfectly medium rare with tender and juicy pink center. A little bit crispy at the edge and the small amount of lamb fat added the unique texture to the dish. Plain asparaguses were not seasoned or added flavors so they can balance the strong flavor created by the curry and lamb. Asparagus itself is crunchy, fresh and sweet, it helped me to cleanse the palate and get rid of the excessive spicy taste. Overall I enjoyed the food that I ordered. This is a restaurant well worth to try and return.

Excellent food and great prices. Tried the the pad Thai Thai one of my favorites. Seafood soup amazing flavor as well and the service has been great both times I was there. Can't remember her name but she treated us amazing and gave great suggestions. I will be back for sure!

I love ordering food from this place. I usually order here once a week. Their delivery is quick and their driver is always friendly and nice. I used to order via YELP all the time, but the driver told me if I called in my orders, I would get a free thai iced tea. So far I've ordered their panang curry lunch special and E-San Set and their chicken and som thum is delicious! I love it!

I was craving some thai food but did not want to drive far from home. Luckily, this resto is near our place and my wife and I stopped by here for lunch. We ordered the following:

Panang Soft shell crab $13

Curry puff $7

Thai Iced Tea $3

Mixed Veggies with Beef $7

Everything was great! The soft shell crab and mixed veggies dish came with soup, rice, and salad. As another reviewer said, the portions they serve is just right and its a good deal. Their lunch specials run about $7-14 which is great. The crab in curry was awesome. I was happy also to have been asked by the waitress beforehand how spicy I wanted it. My wife's dish was tasty too. The curry puffs were tasty as well. It had potato and vegetables with some curry wrapped in pastry. It kind of reminded me of indian food too. Overall, I have to put this resto in the top 3 thai restos alongside Lotus of Siam and Arawan Thai Bistro.
Really excellent food. We had the Massamum curry and Pad Thai. Reasonable prices, good service, nice ambiance. We will definitely be back.

How this place got 4.5 stars on Yelp! right now is beyond me. I came here with my dad one afternoon for an early dinner and the food was so bland, it felt like the greatest waste of money I've ever spent on Thai food. Granted, my family is Thai so we are more on the critical end of the spectrum. 

Firstly, when I spoke to the waitress in Thai confirming whether their yellow curry noodles was "khao soi", she said it was so I believed her and ordered it, since it is one of my favorite dishes. My dad ordered pad see ew since that is how he judges a restaurant on how good this simple-to-make dish is. When my noodles came out, you better believe I was disappointed. The curry was too light and bland, with vegetables that did not belong in there and the noodles were almost like ramen noodles, not khao soi noodles. My dad's order was tasteless, missing key components of a proper pad see ew, like garlic and Chinese broccoli. I can let go of the Chinese broccoli because it can be hard to find depending where you live, but how do you forget garlic in a Thai stir fry dish?! Oh, I almost forgot, the noodles in the pad see ew were old too because they weren't soft as should be. Overall, this place was a huge disappointment and severely overpriced for the quality of food. Never coming here again and telling all my friends to steer clear of this place as well. 

One added star for decor and nice tableware.

I've probably been here 6 or 7 times total and the last two times there were issues. Yesterday during lunch it was busy so the three of us lunch gals got a big table and ordered promptly. 2 orders came out with about a 5 minute delay for the third order, not nice since being polite is waiting until all three of us can eat. After we were finished our plates were cleared and we waited a very long time for our check, we actually had to wave someone down despite the rush being gone. Typically it wouldn't be a big deal but a lunch rush is just that because people have to get back to work. 

The time before that, I was also on lunch with a different friend and I laid with cash. The lady brought my payment back AND the change so I made money for eating there. Of course I have the money back and told her but there wasn't much appreciation. Perhaps they need to have more staff during lunch due to the recent issues. One thing is always consistent.....the food! It's always great but service is huge and it seems to be going downhill. :(







Excellent pad Thai, spice level 3 was just enough to make my nose run but not enough hurt my stomach. The presentation was lovely, the service was perfect and I look forward to coming back on another lunch break in the near future. My coworker loved his beef salad with added shrimp as well.

My wife and I came here tonight for dinner and we were quite pleased.  The atmosphere was very nice, with lovely jazz music playing at a reasonable level.  I ordered the Salmon with Green Curry and it was delicious.  It came with a side of brown rice and its presentation was quite nice.  My wife had the Pad See Ew with Tofu and it was also quite good.  Service was very pleasant and prompt as well. Now the kicker is that halfway through our meal the electricity for the whole block went out ad the staff came up within minutes with candles to provide light on the table and nearly every staff member came to apologize even though it was clearly not their fault.  Then when I discovered I had insufficient cash (since their credit card reader was not working on account of the electricity being out) they said we could just pay next time we came!  I insisted on leaving my credit card numbers so they could charge for the bill.  Even though the power went out we still had quite a nice meal (although we were definitely liking the music they had playing).  We will definitely be coming back to try some of their other dishes.
everything about this place was amazing! i ordered about 80$ worth and took a chance. The food was fresh, flavorful. Will be ordering again

Yet another case of inflated yelp ratings IMHO. I got pad Thai to go with tofu for the lunch special. They initially got my order incorrect but they were quick to fix it and the customer service was great. The spring roll that came with the meal was pretty good, the salad was okay but was drenched with dressing, and I liked how everything was packaged. However, the pad Thai was pretty bad. The entire noodle dish was a strange reddish color (although I got it spicy, it was usual) and I was also wondering why I got a lemon instead of lime with it??? I was really hoping that I'd be able to find good Thai food on this side of town but it looks like the search will continue. 

I would however, give them 5 stars for the service. Everyone I interacted with was very friendly, nice, and quick.

Edit- got food poisoning over this. Not pretty.
Don't know why I didn't trust the review on the pad thai, but it's gross.  It really does seem like they put red dye in it and it has a weird consistency.
Great Thai food, very authentic! Although I didn't eat at the restaurant it was a very classy ambience and the staff was extremely friendly.

This is our favorite Thai place in town. We are always impressed with our food and even though we always get it to go I love the atmosphere in there. It's an adorable little restaurant and the employees are so kind and helpful!
Excellent fresh Thai basil rice!  Clean nice staff and quiet for lunch.
Had deliver from this place.... Absolutely amazing. Very light twist on your typical Thai food. Not the same boring normal .  Delivery took FOREVER -- reason for the one less star.

I have ordered here a couple times now via UberEats!  & every time I have been satisfied. The only food I was a bit disappointed with was the Larp, it was extremely watered down- or oiled down can't decifer what exactly the issue was but something was off. 
I now have their menu on my fridge because that is my go to spot!

Great lunch specials. Delicious food! I had the Yellow Curry with Chicken. Just a hint of sweet with a bit of kick. I definitely could have used a little more rice to soak up the curry goodness, but sadly...the rice was two small scoops. But thats ok...now I know to order a side of rice next time.

Also, got the Crab Rangoon...wwoooooooowwww! Crispy where expected and delightfully flavorful.
The pad thia was amazing  the only down fall was the fried calamari. Very bland, and too chewy.

We had yellow curry noodle with chicken breast (a northern thai specialty), roti with chicken green curry, crispy veggies roll. It was excellent. Not all thai restaurant has this Yellow Curry Noodle delicacy, so we truly enjoyed it. It reminded us of true thai food aroma.

Ate here last night for the first time.  We had the Tom Kah soup, Panang curry and Jade fried rice.  All the dishes were delicious and the service was excellent.  The soup was just a little bit spicy so they adjusted it to make it to our liking.  We will definitely be going back.

Wow!!! I am so glad we found this place. The food,staff and ambiance were all top notch. When we come back to Vegas we will definitely come back. Our $60 uber bill for 4 miles was so worth it after we found this gem.

My girlfriend and I love Thai food, so we decided to try out Table Thai. We were not disappointed! The ambiance has genuine Thai themes and is very cozy. Really, really comfortable chairs.The staff are personal and very  attentive. The menu was expansive and reasonably priced. 

The food: I ordered thai beef salad, and my girlfriend ordered the lunch special - chicken wings, rice, and soup. The salad was a generous portion size and tasted great! There was plenty of beef. My girlfriend really liked the chicken wings. 

Lot's of good food on the menu! I'm going back to try something new.

I'm so glad my boyfriend and I happened upon this place one random night. It's become our go-to Thai restaurant! Love the ambience and the decor. My favorite dishes are the pad thai and crying tiger. Also love their thai tea and thai iced coffee. Mango sticky rice is a MUST for dessert!
Food was delicious. Order spicy Thai is tricky though since the scale is 1-5 instead of to 10. It was still good, even with my burning mouth!

Now that was a good lunch! I had the vegan curry my buddies had Orange chicken and the other one had basil chicken-No complaints and all of us left full. PS they recommend "white people" spiciness up to number five and Thai-spicy to number 10; I chose seven and had a nice sweat (I call that Greek spicy)!  overall great place with a great staff that was very helpful and even brought out complementary chicken soup, and the waitress rrealized I ordered vegan and exchanged out a vegetable soup without a charge! They sure know how to keep me coming back!

I just want to give this place a shout out for understanding the Vegan life! When I called to order my pad Thai with tofu, they asked if I was okay with egg. I was happy to see they were cautious of people's potential diet choices. Especially to those people who are new, such as myself and may not know that this dish contained egg. 
They also helped me pick an app over the phone that was vegan friendly. When I came in and asked what soup they had available the lady (who didn't take my order) asked if I was vegan and offered Tom kah or something of that nature. Which of course correlated with the diet. 
I ordered my pad Thai extra spicy and the soup spicy, they were both phenomenal. I also had an order or crispy veggie rolls, which were delicious with the plum sauce. Thanks for the great food! I'll be back soon!

We had tom yum goong, yum woon sen, fried spicy catfish, spicy fried rice, and coconut ice cream.  Everything was delicious. The ingredient were made from fresh herbs and spices.  Will definitely return the next time we're in Vegas again.

I had lunch with some girlfriends at table Thai. The place is cute cozy and very clean. I loved how all the Thai tea and Thai coffee were served in mason jars. Everything we ordered tasted very good! And the staff was very friendly and the service was quick. We will definitely be back soon. 

Must order the soft shell crab panang! And the the girls also loved the curry lamb chops!

The BEST Thai food in the city, hands down. 

This place is a little hidden, tucked inside a shopping center right next to Sunrise Coffee. The inside is very nicely decorated, with some of the most comfortable couches/chairs I have ever sat on in a restaurant. The restaurant has a level of elegance that makes you feel like you're eating at a fancy restaurant without being overwhelmingly stuffy or overpriced. 

The staff were INCREDIBLY friendly and attentive. My water glass was never even half empty. And they were more than ready to offer suggestions when we were struggling to pick what we wanted to eat because everything on the menu sounded so good.

We ended up ordering the Season Rolls, Tom Kha Soup, Drunken Noodles with Chicken and Massaman Curry. First, let me say how happy I am that a place is finally combining egg/spring rolls with summer rolls on one appetizer. I always want to eat both, and usually have to pick, but the combination is a great idea, and I wish more restaurants did this. The soup was delicious, and a HUGE portion. Not only does your bowl get filled, but the container with extra broth on the side means you get the equivalents of two bowls of soup. The noodles weren't bad, a little too heavy on the onions, but otherwise no complaints. The curry was definitely the star. Awesome blend of spices. 

I'd strongly recommend this place, even if you don't live on this side of town, it is worth the drive.
VEGAN THAI FOOD BLEW MY MIND! I live all the way across town and I will make a 45 minute trip just to eat here. Please never change and keep up the good work!(:

I do not understand how this place gets higher stars it has to be the decor. I walked in and thought wow this place is amazing. Sadly I ordered the Pad Thai and it had no flavor very bland. My friend ordered teriyaki chicken and it was mostly chicken skin. I will never give this place another try! YUCK
I love getting delivery from here--food is always good and they take about 45 minutes, which is reasonable.  My favorites are the Tom Yum soup and the green papaya salad.

I love this place. The service is on point and the food is delicious. For the price you get so much food. I've tried the Pad Thai and a couple of the curries and everything I've had so far has just been perfect. I always recommend this place to my family and friends.

Excellent! 
Super fresh food and fantastic flavors. Very polite staff as well.

Every so often, Yelp fails me. This is that time. What's up with the almost perfect average rating?!?!?! =/ 
Came here for dinner on a weekday evening. It was prime time dinner hour (around 7-7:30p) and there was only one other table besides us. 

First star removal: no wine and liquor? Why not?  But yet there's the word "bar" in your name. By all means, I'm no alcoholic. I actually can't stand the taste of alcohol. My boyfriend simply wanted a glass of wine to go with his dinner. They're been open for what?.....about 6 months now? Or more? Why are they still waiting for their liquor license? 

Second star removal: the food. Just wasn't very tasty. Bland chicken + shrimp pad thai. Not flavorful at all. And only 2 shrimps!?! For a dinner sized entree!? I ordered the chicken thai basil fried rice. Definitely didn't look like FRIED RICE. It was more like mushy rice. The rice was all stuck together and it was kinda.....soggy....if that makes sense. Maybe the rice was under-cooked? Chicken was dried too. Tasted even worse as leftovers and I am NOT a snob when it comes to eating my food two days in a row. I actually love leftovers, but not with this. Minus another star for that.

Only good thing was the appetizer sampler. Two vegetable eggrolls, three chicken satays and 3 shui mais. At least they made that good. We came, we saw, we're done.

Been going here since day one and due to the consistently HIGH quality service and food I have no hesitation giving 5*. We're Vegan and they cater to our every whim, and then some - having products we've not had elsewhere before.

Ate in this go round & I must say it was much better. Arrived a little before the cut off time for lunch & was greeted pleasantly. Ordered BBQ chicken & yellow curry (medium spice) came with soup & fried rice. Excellent meal !! Arrived quickly & was fresh & hot. I recommend..

Quickly becoming one of my favorite lunch time spots. My company moved into the area and I've been in 3 times. Anna and her team have been friendly each time there. I've had the Drunken Noodles (twice) and Pad Thai another time. Delicious.

I love this place! I love that they have a vegan menu :) I had the Vegan Curry it was very flavorful  with tons of delicious veggies and to top it off the people that work here are very nice. I will definitely be back.

This place is probably one of my greatest disappointments. I was so excited to move close to a thai place that delivers but Table Thai ruined that almost immediately. 

My husband and I ordered the yellow curry, garlic lamb chops, lazy duck, and mango sticky rice with thai tea to drink. The overall food portions were ridiculously small and over priced for okay flavor. The yellow curry chicken was the most flavorful dish with some spice but every other dish was bland and lacking. The duck needed sauce. The garlic lamb chops were tough and in need of spices. The thai teas were (in my opinion) way too sweet but when the ice melted down they were good to go. 

All in all, I will only ever order desert and beverages from Thai Table and nothing more. I will not visit here or recommend it to anyone for a meal. 
I honestly tried to give this little joint the benefit of the doubt and encourage you to do the same if money is no object and unflavored food in tiny portions is your deal. Your luck here is probably gonna be better than ours was if this is the case.

I have ordered  from Table Thai approximately 4 times,  never had an issue. Today I ordered something from their menu that was supposed to be meatless. Once the order was delivered I opened it up and found it drowning in chicken. I called table thai back and told them my order was incorrect. They told me that because I didn't say no meat, even though it says there's no meat, they add whatever they think for meat and it was my fault for not saying no meat....the description clearly read no meat! Noodle, tomatoes, basil, and spicy garlic sauce! After arguing with them for almost 10 minutes they finally said they would send another order. About 10 minutes went by and they called me back telling me that my order was on the way and they want the other order back! Can you belive that? Who does that?! What are they going to do resell it? I have the order still obviously but really!! Who asks for a order that was made wrong back?...I will never order from them again.

I was craving some Thai last night and......
I was sincerely pleased with Table Thai. With so many Thai restaurants here in Vegas it is hard to find one that is accommodating and affordable, meanwhile tasting delicious! I chose Table Thai after passing by it on my way home several times. I should mention that I am a vegetarian that prefers vegan options. Table Thai had a variety of options as well as were willing to customize my food to my liking. For example Pad Thai is traditionally made with both egg and a fish sauce, which I do not eat. Needless to say, all my food including the Pad Thai, was Vegan! When I got home I was really excited to see the presentation of the food. Furthermore, it was absolutely delicious. I felt extremely satisfied and confident that Table Thai has earned my business! Thank you.

Went 3 times in one week...crazy delicious, great service & close to home! My sister had soft shell crab panang all 3 times...I originally picked it because it was close by & they had vegetarian & vegan options which were very tasty! This is my new Thai go to place!!!

The food is good and you can tell it's made with love. Although, it was definitely not the best Thai food I've tasted, it goes without saying I wasn't floored.  It was just good...  Staff was very friendly, inviting and attentive. The restaurant ambiance is very nice and a place you could take a date to.  Only negative was I ordered a 4 spicy, on a 1-5 scale and it wasn't spicy at all. I had to ask for the spice tray to adjust to my liking. If you like spicy you may want to ask for the spice tray up front since they don't automatically have them at the table.  Overall, good restaurant, good food, great ambiance and friendly staff. I will be back!

The service was very nice and friendly, the portions were huge, the food was really good and the prices were great. My only complaint is that the chicken in my Pad See Eww was a little on the rubbery and unflavorful side. Other than that this place was great
