Came here for a big group lunch and thankfully we had a reservation--the place was packed and even parking was right! Very clean, modern looking restaurant. I ordered a small Tom Kha chicken soup which was delicious and HUGE! Prices were definitely reasonable, too. The small cup of soup was $5. The server was concerned that it might not be enough food but their serving sizes for everything are massive. Great service, will be back again.
The place is great! I have no complaints. The Sleepy Duck is fantastic. You have to try it. Service is great and it's really clean...kind of a hidden gem

Stopped in for a quick lunch a day or two ago. Very nice and attentive staff, fair price.

I found the food lacking. I ordered a level 5/5 spice panang curry. It tasted like peanut butter and was absolutely not spicy at all. Yes, I know panang is supposed to have a peanut flavor, but this dish was overkill to the point of being kinda gross. 

Perhaps the chef was having an off day, because I heard the girl sitting next to me complain about her yellow curry being thin and flavorless. With so many good reviews, I'd be willing to try again. However if I have another experience like my last, I would never return.

First time here and I can say this is the BEST THAI FOOD I HAVE EVER HAD. Greeted and seated right away. Interior is more modern, low dimmed lights. Which made it more luxurious, rather than your typical Thai restaurant decor. Our server was very busy since it was Mother's Day but she was awesome, attentive and very kind. I ordered papaya salad and spicy basil. Thinking it would be chopped Thai basil but it wasn't. Either way it it was delicious, flavorful and spice level was on point! This is definitely our new Thai spot.
A solid lunch option nearby the office. Friendly service and food is served rather quickly. Their complimentary soup is refreshing and a great starter to the entrée.

We went there tonight because Ping Pong across the street was closed, and I have to say thank god it was.

We ordered the Asia Sample, Yellow Curry, and Drunken Noodle.  The food was so delicious that I had to write a review (and I never review anything).

The food was delicious, the service was courteous, and the atmosphere was great (nice booths, wall hangings, and so on).

I absolutely recommend this place to anyone who is looking for delicious Thai food!
Love the modern feel and awesome spicy Thai food.  Love that you can get a beer or wine as well.  Great place for tasty thai and good service.

This might be my go-to place for food delivery while in Vegas. Best yellow curry I've ever had, and that's saying something considering my family use to own a Thai restaurant. I'm very picky with my Thai. 

Although they impressed me thoroughly with the yellow curry & basil fried rice, I was less than pleased with the drunken noodles and tom yum soup. You'd think with this 50/50 satisfaction rate, that I should give them 3/5 stars instead of 4/5 stars... but no, their yellow curry is that good. I highly recommend it. 

Anyway with yelp eat24, they'll deliver to your hotel. It's cheaper than eating somewhere on the strip. Vegas is so expensive overall these days; smh.

I stopped in here not knowing if they offered take out service. Luckily for me, they do! Anna walked up and offered to get me a menu and then took the time to explain the vegan options for me. She was very nice, and helpful. I loved the way the vegan menu was on the first page and everything was nicely explained. 

I ended up choosing the Tropical Tofu and I was not disappointed, the flavors were wonderful. The portion size was huge, in fact I am finishing up my leftovers tonight. Very good pricing for the amount and quality of the food you get. I really appreciated the fact that if I had wanted something not on the Vegan menu they would have made changes to make it vegan. 

The restaurant itself has a very good energy, nicely decorated and warm. I will be back to dine in when I have more time to enjoy and relax. Oh, and they offer online ordering and delivery service.

Ordered Pho for delivery. After an hour wait (I'm starving at this point), I open the bag & I received everything but the noodles! Called the delivery guy back & he was kind enough to bring the noodles back which took an additional 30 minutes. The noodle portion was the smallest I've ever seen & the quality of the beef was poor. Save your money don't bother with this place!  

Update**
Decided to give this place another shot & dine in. I'm really glad I did, the place is small, quiet & has an intimate setting. My boyfriend & I started with Tom Kah with tofu, it was very flavorful we loved it! My boyfriend ordered the Sea Curry with brown rice, it so freaking good!!! I ordered Drunken Noodles & it was made perfectly. Our waitress was very sweet & she coursed our everything perfect. I would much rather dine in then order out!!

I have been to this place multiple times as it is right next to my favorite coffee shop. 

Each time has been a great experience.  The staff is very attentive and the past two times I have been there one of the waitress has been awesome.  She was very friendly, gave lots of advice on what some of their best dishes were (including what she loved), and also shared a lot of the back story about the restaurant.  

The food was well portioned and good.  The Panang (sp?) curry was really good and the pad Thai was delicious.  I was not a fan of the duck egg rolls put the sauce they served with it was quite nice.  The only reason I didn't give it five stars is because the spice level has not been consistent.  Other then that I would recommended stopping in and giving them a try.

Bomb. Love the people and delivery is the cheapest in the area (that i have found). It takes awhile for the food to be ready, maybe an hour, but I know this and always plan accordingly. All of their appetizers and chicken dishes are bomb. Not too excited about the steak, but ill give it another shot. Anyway, only thai food I like (and I lived in Thailand), and only delivery service I use.

The food here is excellent ( you must try spicy egg plant, crying tiger, lamp panang and beef salad ) and the appetizers is dying for ( duck roll, su mai, chicken satay ). The staff is very attentive and very friendly, they are the group of pretty girls, i promised !!! 
Check out the mango and sticky rice dessert, texturally its a bit strange to people not used to it, but once you overcome it. It's absolutely amazing

Food was mediocre. Service was horrible! We had 5 people in our group and sat us at the "big table" without an option. When our bill came there was GRATUITY INCLUDED because we sat at the big table. I would just advise for future customers to let them know or warn them that gratuity is included if you seat people at the big table. That's all.

We read YELP reviews and decided to stop by on one of the worst days of the year to eat out, Mother's Day,  Yelper's have not disappointed me this time and we will be eating at Table Thai from not on as a neighborhood restaurant.  Being from the San Francisco Bay Area, where ethnic food is the norm and coming from an extensive food background, we're discerning eaters.  This place has all the key things you need to be happy, eat well, not break the bank and enjoy a good time with your special someone or any friend.  Lipi gave us the friendly, royal treatment and a discount for me on Mother's Day.  We tried the Chef's recommendation for Thai sausage with varied accoutrements, which was some of the most delicious sausage (and I am not a sausage person).  The casing was so thin, the flavors meld.  Next came our small bowl of flavorful Tom Yum and you need to order it to taste it and enjoy the presentation.  For an entrée we got the Lazy Duck, and honestly, the portion compared to other Thai places is generous and stunning.  From the minute we arrived, the ambiance, the warm friendly service was apparent.  We plan to go back, maybe, tonight and often.  I rarely post YELP reviews, but Thai Table and their staff, deserve a rave review...  Oh, sidenote, got the biggest Thai iced tea served in a huge mason jar mug and BF had our fav beer to pair with Thai food, Chang.

This restaurant always has such fast and kind service. They do an amazing job of checking in during the meal & are always offering an opportunity for any feedback. They're so sweet and always greet you the second you walk into the door. The fact they're open late as well makes it such a convenient place to come by, no matter the hour. Come here!!!!!
So Far being a veggie this is awesome loved it so many options this is the second time back in 3 week .... gotta try this plave

The service was wonderful. The kind of service were you get what you need before you ask. Our waitress was really nice the food was done quickly and it was delicious. I had the mixed vegetables and brown rice I got a level 3 on spicy and it wasn't spicy at all but it was still good. Perfect for date night or a double date. Once we were ready to go they packed my left overs and gave me rice on the house.
Good service, great food, large portions! I would definitely come back again. For dinner time on a Thursday, there was no wait. The employees are very attentive to the customers.
Ordered a lot of food and didn't have long to wait. Everything arrived hot and was yummy. Grub hub delivery guy very nice and I was very happy with my experience.

My favorite Thai place to go in town! Small dining area but love the ambiance. Prices are reasonable and you get good portions. I like that they serve brown rice as an option as well. Everything I have had on the menu is delicious but my absolute favorite is the spicy eggplant and though I am not a vegetarian or vegan, I get it with tofu. Definitely a place my best friend and I love coming to and will continue coming to!

The best thai restaurant I've tried on this side of town. I love that they have vegan options. Everything seems so much fresher then other places I've ordered from. They also delivery quite far, which I love!

Wow this is much better than I expected I don't remember the name of my salad but it is delicious and loaded with seafood.
Wonderful atmosphere and great service

A long awaited opening but definitely worth it :) As many of you know, I'm a sucker for Thai food and have an obsession for Sunrise Coffee right next door so you can imagine I was pretty depressed when Taiga closed down lol but Table Thai has a lot more options including 10 vegan entrees!  Their menu also includes an assortment of appetizers, salads, curries, soups, rices/noodles, grilled items, healthy options and chef recommendations.

The service was great. Our waters were kept filled, everyone was really friendly and welcoming and they explained to us that they've been having issues with the licensing and other new business paperwork problems since December is a big holiday season and it's been hard with many offices closed and whatnot. But they informed us that as far as they know they'll be open for good now :)

Now for the good stuff! The nums! Me and the boyfriend decided to go with their lunch specials which includes soup, mixed salad and your choice of white or brown rice.

BBQ chicken: This is what my boyfriend ordered. Super flavorful, maybe a little too potent of a flavor for some if that makes sense lol has a rich sauce and you can definitely taste a grill flavor. 3.5/5 for me, 4/5 for Mr.Kitty.

Red Curry: I went with the shrimp version and it was perfect. A good amount of shrimp, good consistency of the sauce, not spicy which I usually prefer but the flavor was definitely not lacking. The only thing, there was an extreme amount of bamboo shoots. I personally don't care for bamboo shoots but if you like them, it would be heaven for you lol. 4/5.

Lunch special soup: flavorful clear broth and I loved that they added two pieces of shu mai which were soft and fluffy. A really nice touch for complimentary soup.

The atmosphere is still cozy with a modern twist like how it was when it was called Taiga. Overall, a different twist on many thai favorites at a very reasonable price. We'll definitely be regulars! Next items I want to try: Pumpkin shrimp curry, Crying Tiger, Steamed fish chu-chee, Panang soft shell crab, Spicy Basil, and Brulee Cheesecake! 

Happy eating! :)

I've just moved here from Los Angeles & I have to tell you I've never had such amazing delicious Thai Food until I came to Table Thai. Coconut shrimp, out of this world. I'm hooked on the Chicken Larb w/ Romaine leaves as shells. The staff is courteous & professional to a tee. Shout out to Anna & Napat. I'm here so much they consider me family.
This is got to be one of the best Thai restaurant  in Vegas !!!! The quality of the food is  incredible  :))))

Friend and I came here for lunch and we were starving. They close at 3, but we were able to get there around 2:15. Two large parties were leaving when we arrived. 

Although the restaurant is on the small side, it's nicely decorated with comfortable seats. I remember seeing 2 or 3 TVs. We were given water right away. We decided to go with the orange chicken lunch special ($8) pad Thai lunch special ($7) and pad see ew ($10) because we thought the lunch special portions would be small. 

They started us off with a small bowl of vegetable soup that had one wonton in it. The meat was pretty tough so I didn't really care for it but the broth was flavorful and sweet... ( I'm hoping there isn't a bunch of msg in there). My friend really liked their soup.

Our food came our quickly and the orange chicken portion was pretty big. The pad Thai portion size was smaller and the pad see ew portion size looked ok, but we were too stuffed to finish anything. The spiciness level in both noodle dishes were supposed to be at a 2 (out of 5) but I felt that that pad Thai was more of like a 3.5. I had to pick out a bunch of (fresh) chili pieces out. Also, the color of the noodles seemed to be very... orange. I wasn't a huge fan of the pad Thai. However, the pad see ew was delicious! Best pad see ew I have ever had. It was perfectly seasoned with a hint of sweetness. Also, the beef was super tender. My friend enjoyed her orange chicken and also really liked the pad see ew. Next time we come back, we will be ordering pad see ew again. 

Service was great. Our waters were constantly being refilled and we didn't feel rushed to finish our meal before their closing time at 3.

The location is pretty ideal, near a busy park (sunset park)and one of my favorite coffee shops in Vegas (sunrise coffee). We were excited to give this place a try. 

The decor is nice and the seating is very comfortable. They have a few TVs on some of our favorite channels so that was a big plus. The waitress was very nice and quick. 

The menu is pretty standard, and veggie options were pretty good. We ordered the vegan curry and fried basil rice with no egg and just veggies. They both came out relatively quick. The curry was a pretty small portion and we were both confused about how a veggie curry could be more expensive than the meat and fish curries...(minus one star) the mushrooms were really cold. Which was weird, because everything else was steaming hot. The curry is standard mild spice so make sure you ask for more heat if you like it spicy. The food wasn't bad, but it wasn't super great. Over all, they have some awesome lunch specials that both of us would be willing to go back and try, but as for dinner and the price, go to komol or Nitayyas. They are also still waiting on their beer and wine license, And since it's a bar and bistro, I'm knocking them a star for that. My boyfriend liked the Thai coffee though. Give them a try and make your own opinion.
My go to Thai delivery place. Always quick , and the food is always hot and delicious.

I came in tonight by myself around 5:30pm got seated right away. I can tell this place is a little more american-ized which isn't necessarily a bad thing. I have a rule with thai places your either a pad thai or a curry very few do exceptional at both dishes. I decided to go with the pad thai thai for $12. At first glance i thought this is not going to be enough food and i came hungry! but to my surprise it was very filling. I got a spice level 2 and it suprisingly had more of a kick then j expected but, it was just right for me. It had both chicken and shrimp which is a nice bonus, although i only got 2 shrimps and few bits of chicken. my overall thought was that it was good. something is missing i can't quite put my finger on it but overall i would come again.
Best. Pho. Ever. I order it like twice a week. I love my delivery girl also! She is always so kind!

Finally found a Thai place in Vegas that I can easily give 5 stars, and only after one visit! 

Fantastic food, good portion sizes, and fair prices for the quality. 
-The cucumber salad was awesome, fresh and came with lots of onion, carrot, and pepper. Not too sweet but instead just good spicy flavor.
-They gave me a complementary seaweed salad that was great. Peanuts onions and more. If not on the menu yet you should ask for it.
-My pineapple tofu red curry was one of the best I've ever had. Full of flavor with onions, pepper, basil, bay leaves. You can add the complementary little chili flakes, chili paste, and jalapeno for a major kick. It didn't need the add-ons, I took a few sips of the broth and nibbled through it I wanted to enjoy each drop.
 
Great service! Patty is a legend! I was greeted, seated, and brought water quick. Got my very good and large ice tea fast which comes in a glass mason jar. I was already stoked at this point. 
The kind server asked if I had been there before, I said no, and she was actually happy to offer suggestions and go over the menu. She asked what I liked with a genuine smile on her face the whole time and you could tell she cared.
Many customers got hugs when arriving and she got told I love you from several people! Haha. 

I'm so happy this place is by my new house and can't wait to try more things. I'll be back often for sure. If you are not close just make the trip and check them out. 

I appreciate Patty and the yelp community for helping me find this place. Thanks and enjoy!

How quickly things change! Very, very disappointed to hear that Chef Troy left the restaurant because he discovered non-vegan ingredients were being served to guests as if they were vegan. Sounds like someone was taking shortcuts; however, for vegans, it is vitally important that we are able to "trust" the menu. My husband and I will not be back to this restaurant.

I wish I could have a positive thing to say about this place but they let me down. The chicken sate I ordered for my Kids was legit RAW (see photos) I hate posting bad reviews but why should I risk the health of my kids and I think it's only fare to warn others. I will NEVER ORDER FROM THIS PLACE AGAIN. I pray that my kids don't get sick from just the bite they took.

Great little thai food spot & gorgeous decoration perfect for any occasion. Excellence & friendly service . The greatest is the food . There are a ton of choices ( included vegan choice ) & there're all delicious , come out with generous portion and quick come out from the kitchen ,warm& fresh . The price & the portion are so worth it . Lunch portion start from 7$ come out with soup salad & big scoop of rice .

This place will get 5 stars from me, every time. 
They have great vegan options. It took my boyfriend and I some serious convincing that the Orange Soy Chicken was indeed vegan because it tasted so real.
So, so good. 
Most places that substitute their main dishes with a fake meat alternative usually ends up too dry. Not here, they're fake meat is unreal. (No pun intended)
Even adding soy chicken in with the yellow curry is really good, too.
It's expensive, but you get what you pay for in my opinion. I never leave feeling like I didn't get enough to eat.
I could drink 45 of their Thai Ice Tea's in one sitting. 
And the garlic fried rice...I've legitimately had dreams about it. Don't ever ever ever leave here without having tried their freaking garlic fried rice.

Overall, the food is fantastic. 

But the best thing about this place is the staff and the atmosphere.
I would go in here everyday after work and they ladies that work here became some of my very dear friends. I never left the place without a hug and without having some good laughs.
And they treated me just as kind when I was a brand new customer.
I recommend it to all my friends who come in front out of town.

I love you Table Thai

"Excellent Food & Services". Cozy place to eat. Food presentation like a "5 STAR Restaurant" at an Affordable Price. 100% Tasty Food Satisfaction . Friendly crews like Patty & An. Owners are down to earth. 

Definitely and Highly Recommended Thai Food in town...

This place is my go-to place for  Thai food that's not TOOO authentic like the market(if you know what I mean), but has all the flavor and taste as an authentic restaurant. The servers were very attentive about filling our water even though I barely drank it. 

I've tried just about every curry here, and they are all awesome! My husband's fav is the Panang curry. 

The Tiger steak is good. It is served medium-well and the sauce served with it isn't spicy at all. It's a flavor that you can't really describe, but I liked it. 

Thai tea, fresh coconut juice, and thai coffee are recommended ;)

STICKY RICE AND MANGOOOOO &&& THAI TEA CREPE! If there's a dessert out there in the world that can put a smile on a girl's face during here time of the month, it's these two right here!
My favorite restaurant in Las Vegas! The food is great! They have a whole vegan menu and any dish can be made vegan. Service is great! 5/5 stars from me!

Delivery service was reasonably priced and arrived about 10 minutes earlier than estimated delivery time.  The man who delivered my food was very friendly.
The chicken Tom Kha soup was delicious! 5 stars for the soup and service, however...

I will definitely be ordering it again in the future.  I was less impressed with the pumpkin shrimp curry as it was pretty bland. I ordered the medium level of spiciness and it was definitely very mild.  There was a good amount of vegetables and shrimp in the curry, but the lack of spice made it pretty boring for me.  2.5 stars for this dish

We found this place through the help of other yelp review were's, and we were very happy with our fine! It's a small restaurant but very nice decor with a good menu and delicious food. We stopped in for lunch and found very good prices for their lunch specials. We will be back!

I would definitely come here if you like Thai food. Not a total authentic place but at the same time has a modern twist to it. I didn't know any good places to find in Las Vegas since I don't live here, but if you're craving some Thai definitely come and try this place out. The service was great and very generous. 

FOOD: 

1. Pad Thai Thai
Chicken and shrimp w/ vegetables
*Heat 1-5* (*for the noodles and entree dishes you have to pick a level of spiciness making 1 mild and 5 very spicy)

2. Orange Chicken
Their house orange zesty glaze on chicken

3. Spicy Basil Chicken
Chicken w/ mixed vegetables & spicy sauce

3. Drunken Noodles
Flat rice noodles with vegetables
*Heat 1-5*

4. Garlic & Pepper Chicken
Vegetables with chicken
*Heat 1-5*

Overall, the whole place is nice and clean. The place wasn't too small but big enough for a table of six. Definitely would come back or do takeout.
Not good just eat there do not take out or deliver The food was horrible when I get it to go it is kind of shady and weird we do love this place but two times we had it delivered it was horrible

Food, service and restaurant was excellent. I had a lunch special for 7.00 that included soup and salad. My entree of choice was Pad Thai, in which I even got level 2 spice (go me). It was great and I'd definitely return when I'm in Vegas! Yum.

Wow
Dosnt do justice, 
Great food , great service , amazing place 
Had the dancing shrimp was great , tom ka was better :-)

Good atmosphere, I really enjoyed my Kong Pow Chicken. The host and waiters were very present and polite. The cook was also in and out of the dinning room checking on orders. I was pleased and will definitely return.

Every time we come to this place we're seated fairly quick and the staff is always so welcoming and friendly. I love the atmosphere of this place! The seats are so comfy and the restaurant is so stylish! It's a little smaller than most places, but always has quality service and food. Our drinks are never empty and they are always giving us refills. 

I usually get the Pad Thai. Ugh, let me tell you... It's super yummy. You can ask for spicy on the side or have them add it for you. I, personally, like to have it on the side so I can control how spicy my food is. We also get the orange chicken for the kids. I highly recommend it. And their Thai tea is exceptional! 

Nothing but good things to say about this place. I would recommend this place for some good, quality Thai food and service!

My friend just flew in from OC and she specifically was craving Thai food. We chose this spot based on the reviews and proximity to Mccarran Airport. The waitresses here were awesome! They were nice and provided great service. 

We ordered pad thai, jade curry, and papaya salad (spicy level 3 for all of them). I am Korean and like my food with a lot of kick. Spicy level 3 was enough to get my lips to tingle a bit. I am not a thai food connoisseur, but this place was pretty darn good. It was just as good as, if not better than, some of the good thai places that I used to go back home in OC. My friend who is very picky seemed to like this place so that must mean something. 

The prices were not that bad and the portion size was enough to feed 3 people. The thai tea here was also refreshing (not too sweet).
Went in Jan 2018 and it was great.  Fried rice was maybe best I've ever had. The yellow curry was really flavorful.    It's a bit out of my way, but I'll be back.

I love Thai food, and I had to stop in Vegas to get my Thai food fix. The staff was very nice, our drinks were always full, and our food came out quick. I had the chicken pad thai, which is my go to at a new restaurant. I got it #3 spicy, which was perfect. It had a good amount of kick, but didn't burn your face off. The dinner portions were good size, just enough to fill you up, and no leftovers. The pad thai was a little different from others, but still really good. It was more Americanized thai, but I enjoyed it and would return in the future.

I tried this today for the first time and was excited due to all the good reviews. I was quite disappointed in their tom ka khar soup, the broth was very oily, tasted like it was full of butter and that was where it derived most of its taste. I then tried the chicken mixed veggies since this is a simple dish that should show their ability to make a broth. They gave me tofu mixed veggies and again the flavor was pretty lame and the sauce very oily. Would only eat here if I couldn't get to my favorite Thai places: weera tha and David wongs pan Asian.

Food was fantastic!! Chic decor and the staff was the friendliest I have encountered in quite sometime, excellent service. Love the Thai tea with boba. Fresh rolls were excellent, and the curry is top notch. I recommend this place to anyone.

I was so excited to try this place being newly Vegan and reading all the great reviews. I was pretty disappointed overall. The service was lackluster, while I was still eating my fresh roll the waitress pulled all the dipping sauces as I was still eating then I had the tofu Mongolian which I got sick from the entire night so much so I had to walk out of a movie. I have been eating tofu and been fine but I knew it was the meal I had just had that was the culprit because I was fine the entire day before this. I won't be returning.

Came here for dinner tonight.  Elegant interior and decor, great customer service, but I wasn't too impressed with the food itself.  

This is a small restaurant.  I arrived between 5:45 - 6:00pm.  There were very few people there, but I was okay with that.  The seats had style and were super comfy.  This is the place to go on a first date.

We ordered the wonton soup, Pad Thai, and Crying Tiger.  

A small bowl of wonton soup is $6.  They deliver the dumplings, veggies, and shrimp in the bowl and pour the broth from a mini pitcher at your table.  Very unique way to present your wonton soup.  The flavor was quite different because it had a sweet flavor to it.  Overall, the soup was delicious, but I'm used to the traditional unsweetened and salty broth flavor.  The soup includes pieces of chicken, shrimp, bok choy, carrots, and ofcourse, wontons.  

The Crying Tiger is slices of grilled ribeye for $12.  It came with a side of small (I think some kind of chilli oil) sauce.  It was a bit dry and on the bland side. 

FInally, the Pad Thai.  It was a bit on the greasy side.  The Pad Thai was big enough to share.  The server didn't ask how spicy we wanted the Pad Thai, so that's probably why they brought it out with a spicy level of 0.  The taste was pretty bland too, but it's nothing that Siracha or hot chilli oil can't fix.  

The ambiance is nice, the presentation is nice, but the food itself tasted a little bland.  Overall this was a good experience, but it's not my favorite Thai place in town.

My aunt came into town and she really wanted Thai food. We were in the area and found this place by chance. The food was delicious and the service was exceptional. I got the tom yum seafood and pad see ewe. It had great flavor and they didn't seem stingy on the amount.
Very helpful staff - very gracious.  Excellent variety - I really liked the curry I was served accidentally.  My pad Thai was good, but the curry was excellent.

This place is a gem! While visiting my old stomping grounds in Vegas, I met up with some friends for dinner here one night. It was my first time here, but I'd heard great things. Table Thai did not disappoint! The decor and ambience was nice, the food was delicious, and their Thai tea was yummy and generously sized. What more could you ask for? If I still lived in Vegas I'd be here every other day.
My favorite spot for lunch. The staff is very friendly, the food is great. The only down side is they are always busy. I have gone there several times and have loved it every time.

Being a new restaurant, we came in with no expectations, and left with a new favorite place!

VIBE: cozy with wooden accents, tufted chairs, crown napkin folds. The atmosphere resembles something more native to that of the downtown LV joints -- trendy, but without the crowd (yet). Another indicator of their hipness is the fact they serve their drinks in mason jars. Yes! I had a thai tea and my sister had the thai coffee. Pretty to look at and a generous portion, for only $3. Young coconut for the same price. Sweet deal. Please don't ever change this!

SERVICE: Our waitress was attentive and frequently asked how everything was going. Our dishes timely cleared, waters were constantly filled, though my glass had a small water stain. Side note: Although the name suggests a bar, I didn't really feel like it's much. They do offer wine and beer, though.

FOOD: To start, my family had the Asia Sampler (a combo of shumai, shrimp, satay, spring rolls), but I'd suggest just getting the shumai by themselves, as the other three weren't anything special. We also got the shrimp tom yum soup -- Drained all of our sinuses, spicy, but in a good way.  Our main dishes: duck curry, yellow curry, asparagus with shrimp, teriyaki chicken, pad thai, and pad see ewe, all ranging from $9-$13. Some came with either white or brown rice. My favorite was the pad see ewe. Although they use the good chicken, the yellow curry seemed a little watery and the potatoes weren't tender enough. For dessert, we wanted to try the thai tea crepe cake, but it wasn't available. We settled for the mango with sticky rice and some coconut ice cream instead. Hit the spot. Great presentation. We'll be back!

We have been to Table Thai Restaurant several times.  The food is delicious and healthy.
They have vegan options as well.  The food servers are friendly and personable, as well as
very efficient.  The atmosphere is wonderful for a relaxing lunch or dinner.
We enjoy the lunch special.  We have had their red curry and mixed vegetable with chicken.
Their duck spring rolls are delicious as well as their appetizer sampler.
We also enjoyed the garlic shrimp with asparagus.
Service is outstanding.
Amazing Pad See Eiw... I can't go a week without ordering it. My favorite noddle dish I have ever had!

Very good Thai food! We ate Panang curry with chicken and tofu, pad Thai noodles with chicken and tofu, and three favor fish! The customer service is A+++. Friendly and attentive! Our server was Anna, and she was a wonderful server! Keep up the great service and delicious food!

It is rare for a restaurant to be good enough (or bad enough) to inspire me to write a review for it.  However, my experience with Table Thai demands that I do so here.

If there has even been a restaurant in my over 50 years of dining experiences that deserves a perfect score, this has got to be the one!

My wife (who is native Chinese) and I dined here a few hours before a flight out of Vegas.  We entered the restaurant hoping for a decent Thai restaurant experience (where our previous Asian food experiences in Vegas have been awfully disappointing!).  Having experienced an exceptional meal here, we left the restaurant seriously depressed that we lived out-of-state and would be unable to return to this restaurant again often!

First and foremost, the waitress/hostess was ENTHUSIASTIC about her work.  She was extremely friendly, helpful, and genuinely cared about our dining experience.  She spent a lot of time telling us about their best dishes (more than a dozen) and guided us in making good choices for our meal.

Second, the atmosphere was very pleasant, tasteful, and elegantly casual.  It was a serious step up from the austere outside view of the strip mall containing the restaurant.  Everything was clean and organized with care and good judgement.

Finally, the food was top notch!  We ordered Tom Kha Gai soup, Phad Thai with chicken and shrimp, and Red Curry with ground pork.  All three were excellent!  Thai food is our favorite cuisine.  So we are quite experienced with these food choices (both in the USA as well as in Asia).

The Phad Thai was slightly sweet as it should be (but not overly sweet as found in many other restaurants) with the right amount of fish sauce (not too salty) and the right amount of spice heat to make it memorable.  (The only odd thing about the Phad Thai was that it was served with a lemon slice and not a lime slice.)  The soup was perfectly blended (not too "limey" or too "coconutty") and served above a flame heat.

The red curry was the most memorable of all!  I *LOVE* curry!  This curry was the most deeply flavored and rich in flavor (but not too thick or too thin in consistency).  Like most restaurants, Table Thai gives you the choice of meats including chicken, beef, pork, shrimp, tofu, and more.  What is not like most restaurants is that they also offer ground chicken, ground beef, and ground pork.  We ordered the curry with the ground pork and found it to be a revealing experience!  The ground pork provided much more flavor to the curry (but not fatty or oily)!  It reminded me of the first time that I tasted Thai food so many years ago.  I remember the excitement of new and wonderful tastes that I had never previously experienced.  This red curry with ground pork gave me that same new experience!!

Wonderful!  My wife and I cannot wait until returning to Vegas in the future solely for being able to eat at this restaurant!!

(Oh, my wife and I could not believe the relatively low prices - especially considering the high quality!)

This place is a hidden gem. Food is delicious and consistent. Ordered take out 2 times and dine in once. Service is excellent. Restaurant has a super cute atmosphere. Lots of vegetarian options. We will be eating here often.

This place is so cute, I love the ambiance! 
&' my waitress was so nice and funny, she gave me a free Thai tea to go because she liked me so much. 
But let's not forget how amazing the food is, not only is the presentation of their food nice the food taste just as good as it looks. I would definitely recommend eating here. I normally eat across the street at ping pongs but they have stole my business forever lol !! Love this place

Went here for dinner with some friends after taking my exam and I have to say the food here is pretty darn good! It's located in a small plaza and has a dim, sort-of intimate atmosphere. 

I ordered the pad thai with chicken and shrimp which looked really good because it had a nice glazed appearance due to the tasty sauce (I hate it when places serve pad thai that looks dry and dehydrated!). I also got a good amount of shrimp (more than 3 pieces!) and chicken. Check out the picture to see for yourself! The quality of the dish as a whole was delicious and I would say it is on par with Naga (although my friends prefer Naga a bit more than here). One advantage this place has over Naga is the fact that their portions are bigger so you get more bang for your buck. 

I would definitely come back here if I am craving Thai food since I had such a good experience. The staff is nice and attentive since they kept refilling our waters without having to call them over. The prices aren't bad and are worth it because of the quality and quantity. 

Check this place out if you get a chance! I will keep you guys updated when I decide to go back here.

For the past two years, this has been my and my husband's go to place. We loved it. We drove across town just to eat here. We came for every celebration and special event. I told everyone I knew to come here. But not any more.

I don't know if it is new management or a new chef, but the food and the service have taken a serious dive. We noticed the change in November and waited until tonight to try again, just in case it was one off night. Nope.

We always ordered the same things: pad see eiw, panang curry, and pineapple fried rice. It used to be the best in town. But now, the panang curry is way too thick and the flavor is off. It used to be so creamy with the perfect balance of seasonings and coconut milk. I can hardly stomach it any more, and the chicken is far different from the thin and juicy slices they used to have. The pad see eiw has come out cold both times with too little sauce and tough beef I can hardly chew. The pineapple fried rice had chunks of balled up rice and no flavor. The spice it totally unpredictable. Consistency is key with any food but mostly when it comes to spice level. You never know what you're going to get.

There used to be one girl working here that was phenomenal. I don't know if she is still with the place, but I haven't seen her. She used to be there every time we came in. It probably would have been better with her here. The new staff is short and seems to try to ignore you. Maybe I'm just holding them to the unfair standard the other girl set...she was really fantastic.

To say I am disappointed is an understatement. I will miss what this place used to be.
Loved this place! Tried the spicy basil and drunken noodles with tofu. Their 3/5 was pretty well spiced in my opinion. The restaurant has a nice ambience. Would love to come back.

I just found this place by accident. Oh my gosh! This must been one of best place in Vegas. We come to Vegas pretty often, stay at strip and do all the Vegas things. But we have hard time finding a great restaurant to meet both of our need, My partner being vegan and I love to eat everything. 
Table of Thai offered selection vegan items, and also anything you see in the menu could be adjusted to vegan. 
Everything we had was fantastic, and service are amazing. They were friendly and helpful. I would recommend anyone who is vegan or vegetarian, and all of meat lovers could be happy with what they have to offer!

Offers a vegetarian menu, this little Thai restaurant in outstanding !  Food is excellent. Service is casual and friendly.  Your water glass will never be empty.  Prices are affordable around $10 for a meal.  Lunch on weekdays is only $7 for soup,salad,rice,entree. Sunset between pesos and eastern.

I was excited to order from here based on all the great reviews. I ordered the Pad Thai, expecting noodles and chicken in a peanut sauce. This dish is nothing like your "normal" Pad Thai. It lacks flavor and was tossed in some sort of red sauce. No peanuts or peanut sauce anywhere. Asked for no green onion and the dish came covered in green onion and had maybe 4 small pieces of chicken. Not worth it.

1st time here....yummy!  yummy!  Patti was our server,  made recommendations and very attentive.  So glad we came here. We had Crab Rangoons,  the Asian Sample,  Chicken Satay,  Pad Thai Thai Noodles.  Everything was extremely tasty,  delicious and great portion size.

It's nice to have some good quality Thai food on this side of town.  Food is fresh, well balanced and packed with flavor.  The Chef and his staff really have a passion for what they are creating as It shows in the plate presentation.   Best time to eat is anytime, how ever, slip in for dinner on Mondays or Tue for some special attention.
We went here with our kids. The dining area is small and quiet. The food was delicious. We had the Crying Tiger, Pan Nang, Chow Min, and fried rice. Everything was delicious and fresh tasting.

Took my wife here on her lunch break this afternoon. This place managed to get us well fed and on our way in under an hour which is a pretty great accomplishment in itself.

But that was the thing that impressed me least.  This restaurant is a modest little space tucked away in retail center that you might miss if you aren't looking closely. The parking lot is tight, and often full.  

I'm not sure why, but the restaurant only had a few other tables when we were there during the peak lunch hour on a weekday. I can't really complain though, the place was quiet and provided the perfect atmosphere for an afternoon lunch date with my wife.

The place is impeccably clean, and well put together. The decor is less like a traditional Thai restaurant and more like a modern bistro you'd find in an urban restaurant district.

We had two different servers waiting on us, making service as quick and efficient as we could hope for given the circumstance. 

I love Thai food, but I can't say I've been the most adventurous when it comes to the menu at most restaurants. Poke fun at me if you must, but I usually get pad Thai, garlic string beans, or basil chicken. 

I tried the pad Thai here, which proved to be an excellent choice because it was one of the most enjoyable renditions I've ever had. Not too soft, with a bold, well-balanced smoky  flavor.

I'm not sure why, but I always request the highest spice level (5 at this restaurant), and Thai restaurants never deliver the heat. As with every place, the server asked me if I was sure if I wanted it so spicy, and when I said "most definitely", I was brought a mild dish. Maybe they've had too many past experiences where people have requested full spice and couldn't handle it so they didn't want to risk having to remake any more food. I don't know, but when I say I want it hot, i'm not playing games!  No worries though, like all great places, Table Thai has a spice assortment of powder and sauces to kick up the heat of the food to your liking.

My wife got the yellow curry chicken, which she seemed to love, and while it did look delicious, I don't enjoy curry so I can't comment on the flavor of her dish, except to tell you she enjoyed it immensely.

They serve an excellent Thai iced tea in a mason jar glass, which adds an interesting touch to the classic drink. Very nicely done!

The food and drink portions were enormous, especially for a lunch special, which is an impressive $7 meal that includes a soup and salad.

The only item I didn't care for was the soup. It was a little light on flavor in my opinion: a simple broth/onion soup with broccoli and a dumpling. I almost feel bad griping about it because it came with my meal so I didn't pay any extra for it and my wife seemed to really enjoy it.

Overall, I think Table Thai is one of the best Asian restaurants I've tried so far in Las Vegas and I'm so glad we found it!

Yum!

Ruby Cury and Lamb Chop Cury are really great!

Warm sake and Asahi paired nicely with the flavors. 

Great service!

This is one of our favorite places to eat when we're in the mood for Thai. The staff is always so friendly and always attentive. We start with the crispy veggie rolls--the best I've had. They're so crispy! And then we usually order the panang curry with chicken plus a veggie based dish. Haven't had a dish we didn't like yet. Definitely recommend this restaurant!
Love this place. Food is excellent and customer service is phenomenal. I highly recommend. Order the Sticky Mango Rice for dessert. You will be back for sure.

Amazing place!
Been here for lunch and dinner and never disappointed. The wonton soup is the best I've ever had (although I wish they'd cut the tails off the added shrimp). So many favorites, never a disappointment.

How am I just finding out about this place!!! Honestly one of the best meals I have had in a LONG time.  Service was quick and the environment was very laid back. My husband and I got the Northern Thai Sausage (ummm...brilliant), a Penang Curry and a Yellow Curry.  Everything was delicious and we will most defiantly be back soon!!!

I ordered several items, and they all have too much sugar in them. I don't like my savory dishes sweet one bit. Thank God the calamari tasted like calamari.  Will stick to other Thai restaurants.  Plus the delivery took over an hour.
Try it today. Excellent food. Thai Fusion with thicker sauces. Will definitely be back.  Food isn't like all the other Thai places. Treat yourself and try Table Thai.
Love this place.  Great venue, very chic and retro.  The service is excellent and the server are pleasant with a beautiful smile.  The presentation of the food is eye pleasing with a good portion.
Best Thai food in Vegas. Seriously!! I go about once a month yummy  Tom Yum coconut soup extra veggies, fresh mint spring rolls, red curry.

Have been here twice and am certainly working it into my list of regular stops during my frequent trips to Vegas. All of the dishes I have tried are excellent. The crying tiger is tender and grilled perfectly. The fried rice has just the right amount of crunch from vegetables and the rice is somewhere between fluffy and sticky. Perfect. The Tom yum soup is also made of some of the best broth I have ever had. Be careful with the "number" of heat you ask for. 3 was almost too much. I also want to point out that they serve some of the best brewed iced tea I have ever tasted and it is served in Mason Jars that are kept full. The two noodle dishes I have tried were also great and portions huge. This is by far one of the best Thai restaurants in town. Try it.
So fresh & delicious. Great selection of vegan dishes. Perfect amount of spice. Friendly staff.

This is my favorite Thai place in Henderson! My boyfriend and I come here when we are feeling a little fancier than takeout, but not fancy enough to make our way to the strip. The restaurant itself is extremely clean and classy, and the food is bomb. We have liked everything we have ordered so far!

This Thai Food restaurant has a great decor and atmosphere. I've been here a few times with friends and have ordered it delivered. I enjoy the panang curry, pad see ew, and curry puffs. My only issue is that a #5 spicy (1-5) is not that spicy. This place charges a bit more than other Thai restaurants in the same area, but the quality, service, and decor are leaps and bounds above nearby competition.

The best thai food I've had in recent memory. Every entree we had was fabulous. Wish I could have this place in my home town. Place seems very popular and we had to wait a while to get seated. But definitely worth it.

Really great service along with really great food. We got the coconut shrimp which was fresh and sweet. We also got the chicken yellow curry which was REALLY good. Large portion enough for two small stomachs and big pieces of boneless chicken. The environment was really nice and they decorated it really cute for Valentine's Day, such as rose straw decorations . We didn't order dessert, but they still gave us two small Valentine desserts and a Polaroid picture of us. Overall, great experience for our first time and will definitely be back.

After two visits to Table Thai and a couple of lunch deliveries to my office, I feel comfortable saying that it's one of my favorite Thai places in the valley.  Table Thai is located on Sunset between Pecos & Eastern, a couple doors down from Sunrise Coffee.

The interior is surprisingly warm and welcoming for a strip mall spot.  It's not large, about 10-12 tables that get packed during lunchtime.  Some of the tables have plush chairs and benches, some have wooden-like chairs; all are comfortable.  There are also a couple of large TV's mounted on the wall if you want to watch while dining.

Our service has been exceptional thus far. Everyone here is friendly and accommodating.  Our server was refilling our water glasses before they were even half empty, courses came out quickly, and everything was hot and fresh.

My most recent visit:
Tom Kha Soup with Shrimp ($12) 5/5 The broth is so complex and delicious that we kept taking 'just one more spoonful' even though we were full. 
 
Green Papaya Salad ($9) 4/5 So fresh and vibrant.  Delicious and a nice palate cleanser.

Spicy Basil with Shrimp ($14) 5/5 I love that their Spicy Basil is comprised of large pieces of vegetables and protein instead of ground up like a lot of Thai restaurants.  I think their 3 out of 5 heat rating was a little too spicy for me (I might be a wimp).  I got a 2 out of 5 when I had it delivered and that was just fine for me!

Pad Thai with Shrimp ($10) 3/5 Tasty, but nothing special.  There are far better choices at Table Thai in my opinion.

Spicy Eggplant with Tofu ($11) 4/5 Very similar to the Spicy Basil with the addition of eggplant.  This one was ordered at a 4 out of 5 heat rating, so I only sampled a piece of eggplant and a couple peppers because it was hot!  But what I did have was very good.

Thai Tea Crepe Cake ($7) I don't want to rate this one because the consistency was gross to me, but the Thai Tea drizzle was delicious.  Everyone else in my group of 5 loved it.
The yellow chicken curry with veggies was out if this world...loved the soup and salad, and the rice was oust and delicious. Definitely coming back again!
Attentive and excellent service, fresh coconuts, and flavorful Thai food! Plus, they offer a Thai tea crepe cake...oh my goodness

YUM... Nice vegan selections, + there are options for tofu in the fried rices & some other dishes. I got the tropical tofu, which was delicious! The tofu was fried but not greasy or thick, it came out perfectly. Jade fried rice was my favorite.

My friend got the green curry with roti, and I had to try it, AMAZING! I'll be getting that next time.  

This place says it's a bar but they don't serve alcoholic drinks, kind of bummed because I really wanted a beer or glass of wine to wash it all down :)

I'm on a mission to find the best affordable Thai food in Vegas. Although, Thai food never is that expensive in general. 

I used to live in SF so Thai food used to be a staple for me, but sometimes it's hard to find a really good place in Vegas.

I would definitely recommend table Thai. The ambiance is nice, it's kind of dark. I got the pad se ew with beef. It was really flavorful, but I found that they added a little too much beef. It was kind of hard for me to eat, a little to chewy. I ended up moving all the beef to the side of my plate, which was 1/3 of the food and just ate the noodles and vegetables in it. 

The staff was very friendly. They kept asking us how we liked the food and were very attentive.

I definitely want to come back and try the curry next time!

We decided to try this place because of the reviews. The place needs a deep clean. the floor, the bathroom, the windows, and to top it of we got a hair in our food. Food was just ok. Service is ok.
Not to go back. I wouldn't recommend.
This is some of the best Thai food I've ever had. Absolutely incredible! Be sure to try the crab rangoons!

This is the best Thai food in Vegas. No need to go anywhere else. Everything was super fresh & tasted great. Staff & owners were very friendly and attentive.! Great lunch specials! Lunch portions will leave you full & the prices reasonable. Had the orange chicken & it was so good.  Not a fan of egg rolls but I could eat their's all day long. The plum sauce is delicious.

Our go-to pick up spot for Thai food. Very generous portions at great prices. If you order online through serve-me quick, there's a $6 coupon as well or an option to get a free appetizer. Ambience is pleasant, and not too noisy. Would love to dine in at some point as well. 

Favorite here is panang curry, spicy with flat noodles. Thai spicy is spicier than the spicy so watch out for that! Overall a great choice.

Food was Mediocre compared to other Thai Restaurants. The server was very polite and sweet, but a bit slow even with two customers at the place. Their bathroom was what impressed me the most. The vegetable eggroll was trash and satay chicken was dry. Coconut shrimp was bomb! The yellow curry which seems to be the rave was too sweet with undercooked carrots and potatoes. They offered to cook it a little longer, but I just wanted to get up outta there.
Nice atmosphere, good service, food ok.  Fine option for Thai food.  Nothing special.
Our absolute favorite Thai place to go. Even better than Lotus of Siam! Patti is always very friendly and helpful with good recommendations. Their vegetarian menu is fabulous!

I ordered delivery consisting of seafood pad thai, tofu pad thai and pineapple fried rice. There was an issue with the order but the manager/owner(?) was more than happy to fix it. For the brief time I entered the restaurant, the staff was nice and friendly. As far as the food goes, it was amazing. I specifically had the tofu pad thai and I couldn't have asked for it to taste better. The noodles were perfectly chewy and it wasn't fishy like a lot of places offer. The portion size was quite large as well. Overall I would eat here again.

Wow super good food, service and prices!  Tried the vegan Four Season dish and it is super tasty and healthy!  Loved the soup that came with itService was quick, helpful and pleasant. Looking forward to coming back and trying more dishes. Glad I found this gem!
The food was delicious and the service was great, just a little pricey but well worth it
The food was perfect...Sea food curry and Pad see ewe were some of the best I have ever had. THE banana pie for dessert was so good,it just wasn't enough...

Searching for a place to eat after visiting the Ethel M  chocolate factory we found this restaurant and fell in love with it! They were very understanding about two families with three kids, once the food arrived the kids were quiet and cut down the business! Might've been the best orange chicken I have ever tried the Phad Thai  was fantastic

Ordered $30 of food via the YELP app. Easy and smooth transaction. Delivery was timely. Panang Curry was good. A little different style with peas and carrots, but nice favor. Consistency and texture was perfect. Also ordered Drunken Noodles. Overall the food was good, timely, and available at a decent price. I would order again.
Wow! Great service. I did not have to wait at all for a drink or refills the whole time. The food was amazing and very beautiful presentation. I definitely recommend this place.

Favorite Thai spot in Vegas. For starters the ambiance is mellow and inviting. Small place but pretty intimate which I like. The food is so flavorful, fresh, and delicious. I love that it's not greasy or over seasoned. My favorite dish is the orange chicken. The chicken is crispy and they make the orange sauce in house. For a veggie lover, I recommend the basic mixed veggie plate. So simple but I bet if I tried to make it at home it wouldn't come out nearly the same. They also deliver which makes my life easier.
Decided to try it based on the high rating. Was NOT DISAPPOINTED,  great service , awesome food , and was very clean . I also liked the chill music , great atmosphere  for a date or family dinner.

I was in the area and had couples minutes to eat at 2pm. This was my 4th time in this little thai place who has an entire page of Vegan Food. The spring roll are amazing. Today the bbq tofu was creative and the sauce as well. Maybe a little to sweet. But I will always stop there if I am around for lunch because the value is rig j t on spot.

I just ordered online through Yelp and had my food delivered. It was so easy and convenient. The food was amazing. I ordered the yellow chicken curry(spicy). Just a heads up, I love spicy food and this was definitely spicy but not too spicy to the point where I couldn't eat it. This was honestly one of the best chicken curries I have ever had, it was so flavorful. I also ordered a Thai tea that was really good, I love Thai tea and could not resist. I also ordered the Kung Pao Chicken for my boyfriend, and it was also just as amazing as the curry. The portion sizes are also pretty big so that is a plus because I can save the rest for later.

Good Thai food. Quick service. Great options of you are vegan. My husband and I are vegetarian (not vegan) - we got the pineapple fried rice and the green play salad. Both were good. The waitress informed us also that their food doesn't contain fish sauce or oyster sauce and it's all vegan sauce - very unusual for Thai places.
I like to come here for lunch. Big portions at a reasonable price. My favorite is the Drunken Noodles...enjoy

Let me start by saying I am by no means a Thai food expert.
We had the Garlic Lamb Chops, Yellow curry, pad thai and the Asia sample platter.
The Garlic Lamb Chops were easily the best lamb chops i've ever had. It was juicy and super tender. The yellow curry was rich and full of flavor. It was loaded with chicken that was perfectly cooked and juicy as well along with carrots and potatoes. The Pad Thai was simply delicious! The Asia sampler had egg rolls, satay chicken sticks, fried shrimp, dumplings, and cucumber relish. Everything was full of flavor and if it doesn't have enough to your liking, they have a platter of delicious dipping sauces. 

The service was superb, they even box your food for you. They were super welcoming and the cook even came out front to see how we liked everything. You can tell they take pride in their cooking.

The atmosphere is the best and the lighting makes it even better. Very good for a date night out.

All in all, i had an amazing experience!

A few years ago, there was a place here called Taiga serving up Thai and Japanese. Then they closed and were replaced by what we have now.

Tonight, I finally tried Table Thai Bar & Bistro, the "new" restaurant at this spot. They're much more focused on Thai food, with a little overlap into Chinese cuisine and possibly Vietnamese, and they seem to have impressed several of my Yelp friends. One of my friends from the Taiga era pulled up the listing when I said that I wanted to go somewhere new to write a review, although I probably would've insisted on something a bit fancier if I'd realized this would be my milestone 700th.

Then again, I've always liked the more affordable and approachable restaurants, which Table Thai definitely is. They have two televisions that were set to Monday Night Football on ESPN, which tonight so happened to feature my hometown and favorite team the 49ers. The music is quiet piano/instrumental stuff, which is relaxing and not at all bothersome. The servers were good and kept refilling our water.

Since I was aware of the lunch specials, I deliberately avoided ordering items on that menu in anticipation of getting better value on possible future visits.

For an appetizer, we shared Duck Rolls ($8), which is basically two fresh-tasting spring rolls w/ duck meat and a delicious sauce.

For my entree, I picked Pad See Eiw with beef ($10), which is definitely among the better renditions of that dish and has plentiful beef, some egg, and... wait, normal broccoli instead of Chinese broccoli? Well, it still gives the right veggie crunch, so it's not a terrible substitution, just an inexplicable one. My chosen spicy level of 1 (out of 5) was fairly subtle, and heat-tolerant eaters probably won't detect anything.

My friend ordered Crab Fried Rice ($15), which had tasty crab meat and fresh cherry tomato among other ingredients. He got it with a spicy level of 2, which was very noticeable but not sweat-inducing for me. It's not too greasy as far as fried rice goes, and I could see myself ordering it again after having had just a couple of bites.

We also shared a dessert, namely the seasonal Mango Sticky Rice ($7). Fresh, sweet mango and hot, sweet, glazed rice balls with a slightly crunchy topping (plus a couple of maraschino cherries for garnish) definitely hit the spot.

Yes, there will be future visits to Table Thai Bar & Bistro. It's a good (albeit very dim at night) restaurant with plenty of menu left to be explored. And yes, there will (hopefully) be 700 more reviews to come.
Me & hubby ordered this through Uber eats and it was amazing. I'm glad I tried this place. My favorite was the coconut crust shrimp appetizer and the basil rice.

We needed something fast, but not necessarily fast food. We decided to order some Thai takeout because this place was located nearby. We ordered through yelp and our pickup time was 20minutes after. Not bad. We were unsure of the size of the lunch specials so we ordered an extra dish. We got 
1) panang curry was thick and creamy, very flavorful 
 2) pad Thai tasted different, but good. The chicken was perfectly cooked 
3)orange chicken was decent as well. 

The portions are definitely on the large side.we were only able to eat half of each entree and we were decently full.

I was craving Thai food one day and since my go-to place was temporarily closed, I decided to try this place out.

Location: Table Thai is located next to Sunrise Coffee. The interior is very intimate and elegant, with no more than 20 tables throughout the entire restaurant. It is dimly lit and very quiet, perfect to take someone out on a date.

Food: 
Thai Tea (4/5): Decent Thai tea, but not the best I've ever had. I'm not sure if it was just my drink, but it tasted a bit watered down.

Jade Curry (3/5): I had ordered the Jade curry with tofu and spicy level 7. I honestly was not impressed. You can order this with either brown or white rice. Though the portions were big, I could not help but notice how watered down and oily-looking it was. After wanting Thai curry for so long, I was left disappointed in my dish. Be careful about spice levels if you do not eat spicy food often. I would recommend no more than a level 5 if you are not used to spice!

Service: Staff was friendly, accommodating, and attentive. Our server was very knowledgeable on the menu and was able to ask all our questions.

With the abundance of Thai restaurants popping up all over the Valley, Table Thai ranks average. I would come back if I was around the area, but next time I crave Thai food I will probably end up giving another establishment a try.
One of my favorite Thai restaurant. Being a vegetarian most of the time I am very limited. But Table Thai has so many veggietrain and vegan option it's amazing.

I love love love the employees and I love the atmosphere and the green curry is so good. I get all vegan here and they're really good with that! I go out of my way. Just to come here. I will drive 40 minutes. To come here. I love it so much
Good food. I love lunch take out, all lunch comes with an egg roll.  The staffs are nice and friendly.

Came for the lunch special. $8 for a really good red curry. The lunch came with a soup, salad, main dish (red curry with chicken) and a side of rice. It was quick, cheap and delicious! 

The staff was really friendly and attentive and the decor is modern and clean. If I'm in this area, I'll definitely be back

This is some of the best Thai I've ever had! Loved the dancing shrimp salad it was an explosion of flavors! The duck rolls were fresh and tasty, the Mongolian tofu amazing, and Thai tea crepe fantastic! Can't wait to return and try it all! Great service and atmosphere.
I love this place, great Thai food and if you ask for no MSG, they'll do it. The portions are huge. Highly recommend

Absolutely love their Tom Yum and Pad Thai! The restaurant is decorated beautifully and very comfortable to sit and relax. This is our go to Thai restaurant because they offer Vegan and Vegetarian options and all are delicious!

lamb panang curry is a game changer! the best curry  I've had in Vegas. so flavorful it's unreal. this will be my local Thai spot just because of this dish. it's pricier than typical curry dish at $21 but it's worth the try. also, the thai iced tea is huge considering the price is only $3. overall good food and will be back. it's only 4 stars for now because I haven't tried enough of their menu but the will change as I will be back!

It's very hard to rate a Thai restaurant on one visit, but this place is very comfortable and hip to eat at. The staff welcomes you immediately during lunch time as they are busy and eager to serve as many as they can. They do a good job in delivering service and turning tables. 
I ordered the penang soft shell crab lunch special and the BBQ pork plate.
The crab penang sauce had too much peanuts for me, but it was good.
My favorite was the BBQ pork because it was delicious based on it's tasty marinade.
I definitely will be back to try some of my basic Thai favorites.

267. Met up with a friend who was also in town. This place is really close to the airport, so it's convenient for those who are either just arriving or about to leave.

I ordered the pineapple fried rice. There wasn't anything amazing to write home about. A tad pricey given a fairly average entree. I will say that when I was there, the service was on point. Maybe because there weren't a lot of people on a Friday afternoon, but at least we weren't being ignored. +1 for making an effort to check in with us multiple times.

Walked in with a group of 10... Every restaurant employee gives giant grimace. 
1/5 for service. 
I tried the pineapple fried rice, pad see ew and pad thai. All were really good. I loved the pad see ew the most! The lunch special sizes were of a good proportion, the soup tasted like  vegetable water. Get lunch special for the price not for the side soup. 
They were quick to give us to go boxes and let us each walk up to the register and pay individually (they would not give us separate checks). 
My only other problem with Table Thai was how thirsty I was after the meal! 
Also, no hard alcohol. Limited number of beers and wines.
ALSO, turn up your AC!!! We were burning up in there!

I love Thai food and the food here is outstanding. It is also close to my work so it is convenient. Go early for lunch because the parking lot and restaurant gets packed. I want to say although the space is utilized well, the decor is very inviting and the chairs are comfortable they almost need a bigger place. I also bring my International students here and they always come back for more. It does not look like much from the street, but I highly recommend that you step on in and check it out!

Ordered the yellow curry (carrots, potatoes,onions, DARK chicken) One of the best currys I've had. I selected spicy and I started tearing up the first spoonful so I'm not sure I should review it considering I could hardly taste anything. Big quantities with tender chicken. Crab ragoons were typical but had more crab than I thought. Mango sticky rice is huge. They give you a whole mango and rice with maraschino cherries as a cute addition. Iced Thai coffee was delicious as well. 

Note: they don't have any of the Thai iced teas/ coffees or desserts on their eat24 online menu so if you do takeout, make it a note. Quaint little restaurant with sophisticated furnishings. I wouldn't mind dining in.
Had some Yellow Curry delivered via Door Dash and it totally melted in my mouth and satisfied my ever increasing Thai cravings!

We love coming here for the lunch special which comes with the entree, salad and soup, and I believe a soft drink. I get their really sweet and delicious Thai tea, so what does the soft drink even matter? We like the dinner specials as well which are reasonably priced. 

My favorite go-to item is the yellow curry, which no matter how much I try to order something else I can't help it. My husband has ordered the pad Thai and it's also delicious. 

Service is good and it's never too busy to sit down and eat, their presentation for take out and delivery is also excellent.

One of the best Thai restaurants in Vegas, especially if you are vegan/vegetarian.  Great selection of vegan dishes, and consistently tasty  I usually order the vegan green curry with roti. It's hard for me to try their other dishes just because I love that one so much, but their Mongolian Tofu and Papaya Rolls are also amazing! They also have the best thai iced tea which can be made with soy or coconut milk.  Highly recommend Table Thai, their customer service is always excellent!

Nothing amazing or WOW about this restaurant...  The food was lacking substance, flavor, and quality.  The prices were surprisingly high given that this is an off-strip, small restaurant. 
 Will not be returning.

Went for lunch 8/9/16 around 12:45pm. Ordered lunch pad Thai noodles $7 add $2 shrimp and papaya salad $9. Lunch special came with a small bowl of soup with 1 wonton and veggies(broccoli, cabbage, green onions)5/5. The papaya salad tasted like it was tossed in that sweet chili sauce, Too sweet for my taste buds. Fresh ingredients but just wasn't executed like a papaya salad I prefer 3/5.  Pad Thai noodles was slathered in a wet red sweet sauce 2.5/5. (Strange that other posted their pad Thai looks different from what I had) Also had side lettuce with a sweet thick dressing, didn't eat the salad. 

Overall this place was busy during lunch time and had REALLY good service. Food wasn't awful but just not "my" typical Thai lunch spot and everything tastes too sweet IMO. Maybe try some other dishes next time just not those items.

I spent a long time contemplating my thoughts on this place,  and after several times getting take out, I feel it's time to give it a review.   A large part of my hesitation was based on how disconnected my feelings were about the food to the star ratings they had accumulated.  I kept waiting to be wowed,  and find an item that I found cravable.   

The only item I found that I really enjoyed was the crab rangoons.   The wrapper is fried just right,  has a great crunch,  and the filling has good texture,  not just one note cream cheese.  Also their dipping sauce pairs well.  After that everything becomes either average, or below... 

The first time I came here I got their chicken satay. While it was tender the amount of peanut sauce they give is very stingy.   It is also more of a curry base and less of the more creamy coconut some places have.  The cucumber salad is also more liquid then salad. Last, but not least several bone fragments were in my chicken,  which I have never had anywhere.  I found it odd so I contacted the business,  and I will say they have very good client recovery.   They apologized,  said this was an isolated incident,  and offered a free chicken satay to prove so on my next visit.   They also threw in a free rice and Thai tea.   I was impressed with their customer service. Also,  thank goodness never have I had another bone incident.   I also made sure the other times when I ordered on line to ask for no jalapenos in my salad, and they were always great about modifying. Still flavor wise I prefer Thai houses chicken satay. 

I found their Tom ka soup OK the first time I went when I got it with tofu,  however when I got it with chicken the second time it was to salty,  and the chicken had a weird texture. 

The pad seew was really disappointing,  no dimensions in flavor, and the second time it looked like they cooked egg seperatly and just tossed it on,  so it was not coated in the sauce,  just super weird. Their was another flat noodle dish that my boyfriend tried it was on the spicier side, so while the flavor was good a 3 out of 5 was to hot for me to eat more than a bite of.  So keep in mind at least that night they  definatly ran Thai hot. I normally like thai tea to cool down the the heat,  but theirs is to sweet,  and not very flavorful. 

They do have a vegan menu which I know some will appreciate,  although I have not tried it. Also,  one of the reason I gave so many chances was they are open about an hour later than most Thai places near me. I really want to like this place more,  maybe I'm not ordering what they are known for.   Until I figure out what that is I'll just keep ordering here when my normal spots are closed.

I am very happy to find this place. The restaurant has a very nice and relax atmosphere 5/5. Decoration inside is modern and classy 5/5. If coming with friends or family or bringing a partner on a date night,  you would not be disappointed. 

Most small Thai Restaurants offer just ok food and average decorations. But food here is super!!! Not only food looks so pretty yummy 5/5 but the taste is also delicious 5/5. Today, I started with Crying tiger. The sauce is so gooood 5/5! Then Spicy hot basil spaghetti and Panang Soft Shell Crab are next.  Wow, I've not seen these menu at other thai places. These ones looked amazing 5/5 and are very tasty 5/5!! My friend also had vegan orders; Roti with Green curry and Tofu Larb. Super yummy 5/5! People who are vegan will like it here, they can add soy protein or custom their orders. The restaurant also offers brown rice and variety options for health lovers! Final order is Mango sticky rice; it is so delicious 5/5!!

The service are exceptional, fast 5/5 and friendly 5/5. The quality of food and restaurant is outstanding 5/5. I recommended to everyone. You couldn't be happier. I will come back here again for sure. My next time order would be Duck roll and Clay pot... Can't wait...

Definitely an awesome place. I will come back again for sure. The taste of the food is fresh and spices are distinct. Not fish oiled at all. I tried 4 dishes and all were great. Can't wait to be back. Now this is my second review. Excellent food. Tried the same two foods from last time and the taste was very consistent with last time. Glad i don't have to drive too far

Nice little spot with great ambiance and staff is very friendly. Vicky my server guided me over the menu and asked what i liked and made recommendations. The crab rangoon is some of the best and i had the crying tiger sirloin very spicy and tender.

I have driven by Table Thai so many times and wanted to give it a try. Last week I decided to call in a take-out order for lunch. 

The woman that answered when I called in my order was very friendly. She said my order would be ready when I arrived and didn't even give an amount of time. It took me about 10 minutes to get there and my food was waiting when I arrived. Looking around the restaurant as I paid I was impressed with the inside of the restaurant. It has a clean, modern feeling. 

The Pad Thai lunch special was calling my name. It came with a nice portion of pad thai (choice of chicken, pork, or beef), a vegetable egg roll, and a green salad. From the menu it looks like dine in lunch specials come with soup too. Even without soup I ended up having leftover pad thai for the next day. I really liked the flavor of the pad thai dish and the chicken. The green salad had a nice dressing and I enjoyed the flavor of the egg roll too. I would definitely order this dish again.

The lunch specials are an amazing deal. There are 16 different options for $7! Yes, $7! Even with tax and a 20% tip I made it out for $10. I can't think of any places in town where you can find a better deal for a quality meal. Lunch specials include an entrée, green salad, vegetable egg roll, soup (for dine in), and rice (unless it's a noodle dish). 

I look forward to returning not only to try more of the lunch specials, but to bring my husband for dinner.

3 stars for the service but would only give 2 for the food. It was too bland for my taste. We asked for medium spice and it was no spice and no flavor at all. The service was great and the place is really cute inside but the thai food here does not cut it for me. Probably will not be back here.
I ordered online through Yelp.  The delivery was easy and it was delivered fast!  I highly recommend the mango with sticky rice.

Ohmygosh this was delicious!!!!! We came from out of town and stayed nearby. Saturday night, we were looking for a good place to eat and my mom was craving Thai. We did a little yelp hunting and found this place. Literally every single thing we ordered was delicious. In the middle of the meal, my mom commented, "Well we definitely have enough to get a to go box packed up and I can eat it for lunch tomorrow." And by the end of the meal, that was no longer an option. We had cleared our plates. I will absolutely be back whenever we are back in town.

I have to write a follow up review because I had delivery again, but tried new things. Slightly disapointed in what I got this time.

Orange Chicken: Sauce was extremely delicious, had little bits of orange peels in it and great flavor. The chicken pieces were extremely sub par though. It was deep fried and breaded- but I couldn't taste any chicken whatsoever. Only a couple bits had even a noticeable piece of chicken in it. After about 5 bites the novelty of the great sauce wore off and I realized I was just eating deep fried bread with orange sauce.
 
Sweet & Sour Chicken: Ordered in order to take to lunch the next day. Same deal as the orange chicken. Extremely small to non existent chicken deep fried in too much breading. I ended up just throwing it away because of how unappetizing it looked after the orange chicken.

I recommend staying away from these two options as they are $10-12 and have little to no chicken in them. Very disappointing.

Table Thai is my go to spot for lunch in Henderson. They offer lunch specials that are good for pick up or dining in. 

I always get the Pad Thai lunch special for $7. It also comes with an egg roll and a salad! The portions are big! Especially considering that it is a lunch special. 

I recently ordered through Yelp and I was surprised by how fast and easy it was! Everything was ready to be picked up in 10 minutes, despite them being busy when we got to the restaurant.
