Other dishes that I've tried include the soft shelled crab panang curry (also offered during lunch if you feel like splurging a little!) And they also offer vegetarian dishes that are so good that you don't even miss the meat. I've tried a crispy tofu dish that was amazing!! 

And for dessert, you must try their Thai tea crepe cake! It's so light and fluffy and not overly sweet.

Visited this place several times and every time I have had a good experience. The banana pie is awesome and you can substitute the honey for mango sauce if you're vegan. The soy chicken fried rice is sooooooo good! The soy chicken to me tastes a lot like BBQ pork you'd get in standard fried rice but the cruelty free version! Love the service and the food! They actually want to take your order and get it correct the first time and clarify if they need to. I will be a frequent customer!

HUGE thai iced tea and thai iced coffee (but also super, super sweet)

Food was just ok compared to the reviews posted here.  Tried the penang curry (which was so rich it felt a bit more like eating a peanut paste to me) and the drunken noodles were flavorful, but still not great.

Nice ambiance, but only ok thai food.
Tasty food, excellent service, we ordered tom khan soup and the salmon. Hot level 3 from 5, next time i try 4!! My Thai place in Las Vegas!!

Wow! So, so good... service excellent. In fact,  needed a little more rice for our dish, and no extra charge like most other places!  They know how to treat and appreciate their customers!! Oh,  and FRESH brewed ice tea... the best!

We decided to try this place being it seemed new and we like Thai food and compared to other places it was ok.  Some items were kind of bland and tasted different then what was expected.

We have eaten at many Thai places in Nevada and other states and most of the time you find the taste you are looking for or expect compared to your visit at other places.

This place uses a lot of HOT spices which for me was good, but others with us on this visit are not fans of spice.  They ordered the Orange Chicken and the Sweet and Sour Chicken which are two items I am a huge fan of and I don't know if it was the breading or the sauce was different, but they thought it was ok to not really liking it.

I tried it even though it is not on my list of approved foods to eat right now and I even thought is was less then ok.  The breading was very soggy and did not have a good taste to it and that goes for both chicken dishes.

This is a place we probably enjoyed trying once but will not be on our list to visit again.  There are other places which are just a few steps better and worth going back to.  Sorry to say this is not one of them.

This place serves awesome Thai food!! Came with a fairly large party, yet the service was friendly and quick the whole time!! Very cute decor including the cute lil coconut drinks served in actual coconuts. Not a huge fan of lamb but I must say they have a garlic lamb chop dish that is to die for. Must try their lamb panang, beef salad and spicy crab fried rice as well. Everything was awesome and the options were endless. Save room for their desserts and wear stretchy pants!
My favorite place. Beautiful and cozy place, excellent service (for me service is very important) and price is very reasonable! My son (3 year old) love this place!

Let's get one thing straight: Nobody likes those little crispy white pubic noodles on their food. Even our spunky waitress, expressed her disdain for them. She said they get stuck on her forehead sometimes. But that's neither here nor there. Let's get down to the review. Late night Table Thai and Bistro filled my tummy with happiness and warm, authentic Thai cuisine. After watching Muslims shoot Christians with machine guns at the local theater, Randall and I had worked up quite an appetite. All of the standard favs were closed, so we rolled the dice on this gem. Upon arriving, we noticed the small sign in the window that read "vegans welcome". This was almost as refreshing as the young coconut we ordered. We also had the soy orange chicken which was FIRE. I only wish they were open 24 hours so I could sleep here.
I definitely recommend it . Nice enviroment, the chairs are so comfy, and everything is so cute. The food was fabulous also the service. Special thanks for Napat that took really good care of us.

Spicy Eggplant was amazing!! Restaurant is small but very nice- even a little fancy. It was immaculately clean. Service was very good! The only thing I would change is the piano music; something more modern or lounge would definitely improve the ambience.

This place is a staple to our diet and our social lives.  Over a year go, we tried this place based on very positive Yelp reviews.  The food is amazing and you'll enjoy all of the normal staples that most people learn to love when it comes to Thai food.

We elected to have our wedding rehearsal dinner here and let me tell you, that was an amazing event.  The owner and staff went out of their way to host a wonderful multi-course meal all while having a very fresh atmosphere that all of our guests really enjoyed.  We were able to order a bunch of different menu items that many folks had never tried before.  Not only was the event a lot of fun, but the resturant has opened our eyes to many other Thai dishes that we might not have tried in other places.

Our family continually returns to a thoughtful staff that serves great food.  Give this place a shot and try the Larb!

First off - the service is exceptional. Our waitress was very friendly and attentive. Now on to the food - AMAZING!  The shu Mai appetizer was delicious. For entree we had the blue canvas curry and the spicy eggplant with shrimp. The curry was delightful - creamy and full of flavor. The eggplant picked up deliciousness of the home-made sauce and was really really tasty. They make all the sauces from scratch here so they all have a very unique flavor. I will definitely be back again.

So many Thai restaurants in this town. It's hard to choose....We had the tom kha soup, chicken basil, along with the garlic lamp chops. The food was awesome! Service was good. I recommend this place. I liked how they had the heater on the table for the tom kha soup to keep it hot. The ambience is trendy with nice classical dinner music in the background. Good location for a date night.

Whenever I walk toward the entryway of Sunrise Coffee I have a tendency of looking up at the low flying airplanes ready for landing at McCarren International Airport. A couple of weeks ago, for a change I decided to look down where I set eyes on the Table Thai lunch menu. Where the adventurers in the airplanes were about to land this adventurer was about to take off on a flight that carried me to an interesting dining adventure. My dining adventures at Table Thai would be my first. This marks the first time that I have dined in a Thai restaurant solo. This review reflects on my two food adventures in Table Thai this past week.

  Both times that I ate here, it was off the lunch menu. Everyday, Table Thai serves a lunch special from 11 AM to 3 PM. The prices range from $7 to $13. The majority of the lunch specials include mixed salad, rice, and wonton soup with a glass of water with ice. I'd order the barbecue chicken on the leading visit then pad thai on the second. Further into this review, I will talk about them in further detail. 

  Upon walking inside, I was surprised to be surrounded by an upscale interior. I expected a take out environment. A friendly lady, I believe is one an owner, walked me to a table by the open kitchen. We walked on a new brown floor that the lady would joke with a customer that you can dance on it. Forget about wanting to dance, it would be hard to want to leave the comfortable booth seat. First off, the waitress put the glass of water and ice on the table. I ordered a Coke ahead of the meal. The waitress opened a can of Coke that she poured in a glass of ice. I failed to see hot tea on the menu. After she poured the Coke, I ordered the barbecue chicken. There was around a 15 minute delay before the freshly made lunch arrived. I entertained myself with the Internet compliments of the complimentary Sunrise Coffee WiFi next store. 

    The barbecue chicken lunch plate was 1/4 entrée, 1/4 rice, and it seemed 1/2 mixed salad. The barbecue chicken was quality over quantity. I enjoyed every bite to the bone. This chicken would leave a nice aftertaste that is a sign of using quality ingredients. The rice was allright. The brown rice I ordered looked more like white rice. And tasted like white rice. The wonton soup came at the same time as the meal. It featured one wonton, broccoli, and peas. After lunch, I decided to return to try pad thai. 

   My second visit was a more adventurous lunch. This was the first time that I dined in a Thai restaurant by myself. This is the first time I partook in a meal with only water. And it was one of my leading times eating pad thai. This was more of a genuine Thai restaurant experience than the last. What is a good Thai restaurant experience? According to McDang a well known expert on Thai cuisine, the food must have intricacy; attention to detail; texture; color; taste; good flavor; and the use of ingredients with medicinal benefits. My pad thai met McDang's expectations with the exception of ingredients with medicinal benefits. The pad thai lunch was $7 and included wonton soup, mixed salad, and water. The pad thai occupied 70% of the plate. My protein was chicken. I told the waitress to make this stir-fried rice noodle dish with a 4 out of 5 spiciness. The pad thai was outstanding. I did not feel the 4 out of 5 spicy. Maybe I have a tolerance to spicy food. Regardless I know great food when I taste it. 

  Based on the two visits, just like the barbecue chicken the experience left me with a nice aftertaste. That means that I might be back. If I return here, I would order the pad thai over the barbecue. It appears that pad thai is one of Table Thai's signature dishes. Then again I might further extend my horizons and try something totally different.

I've had table thai a couple of times. I usually only eat here during lunch cos my workplace is so close. I come in around 12:30-1 & it's pretty packed. They'll have 1 or 2 open tables. 

I would rate their food 3/5, honestly. During my last visit, I ordered tom yum soup with shrimp & the yellow curry with chicken. Something was off about the tom yum. It tasted... sweet? I was very confused lol but I got a spicy level 3 out of 5. It wasn't bad at all, it was just sweet. The yellow curry was alright. I've had better at other Thai places. I've also tried their pad Thai before & wasn't impressed. Maybe I just haven't ordered the right thing?? I really want to like this place since it's so close to my work lol. I don't wanna venture off too far. Maybe I'll keep trying different menu items. 

The customer service is definitely 5/5 though! They're very attentive. This also might be because their space isn't that big.

Seeking a lighter dinner, we canceled plans for dining at a steakhouse and headed to this recently opened Thai restaurant.  My better half ordered pumpkin shrimp (red) curry while I chose the spice herb catfish entree. Her curry was rich in flavor and contained several good sized shrimp while my entree was bursting with flavor.  Menu prices are more than reasonable considering the quality of the ingredients.  Highly recommended.

This is a solid Thai restaurant located on the East side of the Valley. It's small but has a clean, upscale feel. Dimly lit, it's also quiet, making it a nice place to enjoy a low key meal. I took my lunch club there and everyone raved about the food. I had the lunch special with a drink and my tab was under $11 without a tip. Wow. Hard to find a good lunch for that price. The waiters were prompt and gracious. We even asked for separate checks and they were fine with that.  I was a little upset because two of my group did not show up but the waitress took care of removing a table so it worked. I will go again and take my husband next time.

Some of the best Thai I've had in Vegas!!!  I've traveled to Thailand for the last 20 years and this place gets as close to "home" Thai cooking than I've ever had in this town.  The service was top shelf; the prices are spot on; and the food was amazing!  I had the Tom Kha soup and the Panang Curry and both tasted like I was on the streets of Bangkok.  If you like Thai food--THIS is the place for you; and if you haven't tried something new--THIS is the place for you as well.  

I'll be back again and again and again!

I wanted a quiet meal after a LONG day at work on my feet, and I had a craving for Thai. My usual Thai place in Las Vegas is always super busy and bustling, so I decided to try something new. Table Thai is located a bit off the beaten path, and the area around it seems mostly commercial, so they were pretty quiet for dinner. Just what I wanted! 

I was absolutely STARVING, so I ordered pad see ew, extra broccoli, with both chicken and tofu. The portion sizes are huge. Everything was prepared just the way I like it. Crisp veggies, not overcooked. Just the right amount of spice. The tofu was crispy on the outside, and soft on the inside. Good flavor. Tons of noodles. Not too greasy. I tried my best to finish it because it was so good, but I didn't quite manage. 

The waitress was sweet, helpful, and attentive without being overbearing. Bathrooms clean. Parking easy. Modern decor. Definitely worth checking out. 

I will have to go back just to try out the dessert menu.

Just ate here, and it did not disappoint!!
Tom Yum soup and Thai Sausage were some of the best I've ever had. 
They also have a Vegan section.

I had been wanting to try this place for awhile and I was so excited when I was finally able to go. The employees are really nice and the restaurant itself is really cool and well decorated. I ordered the orange glazed chicken, which was honestly some of the best I've ever had in my life. My girlfriend ordered the LARB tofu and she loved it. 10/10 recommendation to anyone who is curious about this place, and I will be back many times!

A bit Americanised...pad thai was a bit bland, no fresh chilies, some strange red dye too.  Serve lemon vs lime which is not authentic.  Thai basil chicken was over filled with bell peppers and no taste.  Service was good but the food was lacking in authentic flavors.  

Will stick with Penn;s Thai House down Sunset near Gibson.  Truly authentic Thai....

Ordered Panang curry and the chicken was raw.

The taste of the curry was amazing until I got to my first bite of pink rubbery chicken then I had to hold back my vomit....

If the chicken had been thoroughly cooked it probably would've been perfect. I would just rather not risk that experience again or bother risking salmonella/food poisoning. 

I won't be back to say the least. If they make sure their meats are thoroughly cooked I'm sure it tastes great. Just a risk you gotta take I suppose. I just personally can't stomach raw chicken.

Good luck.
Nice place to eat on a casual night. The staff was extremely kind and helpful. Tasty food but I took off a star because my food was semi cold in the center.

Just opened a gym in the area and was looking for a good place to eat after a hard days work, and man did I happen to come across a really good Thai Restaurant. Not only was the service impeccable, but I couldn't pick which dish was my favorite out of the 5 I had. From the Asia sampler, the the 3 Entrees, to the Mango Sticky Rice... they were all sooo good. Looks like I'll be coming here quite often since my gym(@fiit_factory) is now just down the street

I absolutely love this place, its a cute small restaurant, seating is limited, but its such a popular place that its completely understandable (fills up face).

The food is amazing, my fiance has his go-to Kung Pow Chicken, and I am a big fan of their Pineapple Fried rice, but I try to brach out every now and again. We go here at least once a week, and always enjoy every bite. 

Because this was place is family owned, the service is always top notch !! Love taking people from out of town here because its always amazing !

Heads up kitchen closes at 10:30 even though Yelp lists open till 11pm. Just drove 15 minutes after work to arrive at 10:35pm to be told kitchen closes at 10:30pm even though there was another person just starting their main course. Very disappointing was really looking forward to it. Unlikely I'll ever give it another chance.

CAN'T BELIEVE I'VE NEVER LEFT A REVIEW!

I've been here a few times.  This place is elegant and offers a great menu.  Everything is fresh and they make sure its brought out the way you want.  

Must try the crepe cake! 

This isn't an average review, you won't be disappointed.

This is my favorite lunch spot. The price is great and so is the food. The only reason they don't get 5 stars is because they get very busy. There's been a few times I have waited on my lunch hour and had  to leave and get something on the go because no where to be seated for 30 mins. I think they should expand as they have a nice customer base but overall great place to eat. They are also very attentive.

First time in Vegas and was craving Thai food. Yelp had good reviews and tried it out. Absolutely awesome restaurant!! Food and service both are fantastic! Staff is so friendly and helpful. I'll definitely be stopping here again on next trip! Yummy Tom yum soup.
Best Thai place in town. Always good to eat in or take away. Even delivery never lets me down. Delicious and consistent.

Omg, this place is good.  I finally got to try it and am so glad I did.

I love the presentation.  I had the Tom yum soup. They bring out a bowl with the mushroom, chicken, lemon grass and herbs. Then pour the broth from a pitcher. Great flavor!  

I also had the jade curry with tofu. Very nice.  The vegetable were good quality and not over cooked.  You get quite a bit of food. 

Next time, I'll have to bring more people I can sample more dishes!

Definitely eating here again.
Awesome everything! Food, service and ambiance! Found my new favorite Thai spot. I am definitely coming back!

We had such a great meal here. We genuinely enjoyed the ambiance, the service and the food. I'm so glad I found this spot. My favorite thing on the menu was the Tom Kha Soup. Oh my goodness!!! It was soooo good that I am craving it right now and it's only been a day since we last ate here. Our server was very funny and kind. Anna definitely makes me want to come back.

I've been a couple of times and was not particularly impressed.  The last time, my pad thai was an odd color and tasted like orange chicken so I didn't even finish half of it.  When the server cleared our dishes, she asked was everything ok.  I said it wasn't what I expected and I did not enjoy it.  She offered something else but I said no thank you so she brought the bill.  They didn't even take the pad thai off of the check!  Not only did I get served terrible food, I still had to pay for it.  I most definitely will never be back there.
I eat a lot to Thai food, this place was the best Thai food I had by far. I would recommend everyone go and try it out

This place is seriously the greatest Thai food I have ever eaten! Great ambience, great service, delicious and aesthetically pleasing food all at great prices!!! The servers were super attentive and nice my drinks were never empty. And they were always smiling. I will 100 percent be coming back here as many times as possible!!  Anna, may, and Cindy were amazing!!! Great trio!!!

I came here on my lunch break with my mom and I have to say this place has the most comfiest chairs lol The ambiance was chill and the service was quite nice! I was also quite surprised by the roses that were made for the straws! I didn't have the heart to throw them away or crush them so I ended up keeping them :) Idk if that was just for V-Day but I was so taken away someone took the time to decorate them before they hit the table! 

Food: We ordered Steamed Gyoza for an appetizer and it came out very professional looking and looked like someone actually cared about their food! A+ As far as an entree order we got the Pad See Ew with shrimp and the BBQ Chicken. Both had really good flavor and overall we had a really pleasant lunch. We didn't feel bombarded by the staff and was able to enjoy a great lunch together. 

Definitely would come back again to try the other dishes like the curry! :)
Love the crab fried rice. A little pricey however, the food is very good. Watch out for the level 5 spice it's hottt!!!

This is an amazing Thai place, small and modern with amazing service.  Food was exactly as it should be, legitimate Thai food. Huge portions, enough to feed two people. So be prepared to share and have left overs. 

Ordered pineapple fried rice and green curry.  They rate their heat on a 1-5 scale, based on other Thai places I've been to they usually say 1-10. I'd say "2" is like a 5 on the heat scale.  

I will definitely be going back here in the near future whenever I need to get my fix, especially due to its close proximity to sunset park.  Great date spot for those that would want to go to the park and walk around to talk afterwards.

My friend has strict dietary restrictions, and I just happen to love reading yelp reviews. We came here in October to check it out and fell in love. It has been my favorite restaurant for months.  We have had the Massuman Curry, Tom Kha Soup, Thai Tea Crepe Cake, Mango Sticky Rice, Spicy Eggplant, Salmon with Mango Salsa, and their amazing Thai ice tea with coconut milk. They always make sure everything is safe for my friend, and it's always delicious. 
It's easy to tell that their food is homemade. Whether I eat here or order delivery, the quality is consistent. A nice, rich, and creamy Tom Kha with the right amount of lemongrass can be hard to come by, but Table Thai does it right. If you have a sweet tooth, the Thai Tea Crepe Cake is a must have. The food is amazing, and they always remember a friendly face. This is definitely a place worth visiting and returning to.

Found PLASTIC lids in my leftovers. 2 different ones. Found one before heating it up, tossed it aside, then found another melted into my food after heating it up on the stove. 

Used to love this place but I can't imagine eating here ever again.
Amazing food, great atmosphere, low prices, excellent service. Love this place!!! I met a friend there on Wednesday, the place was busy. Love the fresh rolls, Satay.  It's all delicious.

Went there alone tonight around 10pm. It was nice that they were open late. I ordered the Panang curry with chicken, spicy #4 (out of 5) and a coke. They have coke in cans, and it bothers me paying $2+ for a can of coke, and the water came warm from the tap with a few ice cubes and a sliver of lemon. The place and food presentation are nice, and most of the servers are nice, but I won't be dining there again. My food was not spicy at all. I had them bring out the little pots caddy thing with the spicy stuff and it mildly helped. When I told the server I did not wish for a box, she grilled me about why not. I plain out told her that it wasn't tasty or spicy. She said,"oh, ok. Next time, save room for dessert." Wow.

This place is one of my most favorite Thai Restaurants.  When I think of Weera, Kin Thai, Siri Thai, Sakun Thai, Naga, Gaati, Komol, Lotus of Siam, Lucki and all the other places in town, I love coming back to Table Thai Bar and Bistro.

1. Service - The staff here are very nice and friendly. You always feel welcome here.  they are very attentive and making sure you are taken care of. Even when it is busy, they are available.

2. The Food - The food here is great.

Lunch - For about 7-10 dollars, you can order 1 of about 10 specials from curry to spicy basil or pad thai.  Your will have a nice lunch size serving of the dish, as well as soup, rice and a small salad. I find that this is a great deal and the amount of food is just right.  Great food, great flavor and great price. Can't beat that.

Entrees - They have just about any and all Thai dish that you could want.  I won't go into any great details as the choices are similar everywhere.  Here are some highlights though:

Ground Meat - I love to have ground pork on my Thai dishes and some places have it, and some don't. HEre they have the ground pork. It captures the sauce and spicy flavors so much better than larger cuts of meat.  The best part, is that they can do ground chicken as well.  I generally prefer the consistency of the ground meats in Thai cooking. Not many places can do ground pork or ground chicken!

Tom Yum - I always enjoy it when the soup comes out in the soup hot pot with the fire in it steaming. Here it is just right and slurpiliciously good.

Vegan Menu - Many places will have a vegetarian menu, but here they have a separate Vegan menu. That is great, especially since the daughter has been a vegan now for about 5 months.

3.  Ambiance - The amount of tables, the design and everything about this very small restaurant is just right. I love coming here with the family and also on business lunch meetings.

GK says, check it out. One of my favorite Thai restaurants.

I've been here a couple of times before the restaurant gained popularity on Yelp. I loved it before. It's such a cute, little modern place. It's clean and nicely decorated. The staff is very kind and gives great service. The food was good too.

Tonight, however, I ordered the crab rangoon, beef salad, and pad Thai. The crab rangoon was good, always one of my favorite dishes to eat. The beef salad was too sour. Almost too sour that I couldn't eat it, when I love to eat sour! The beef on the salad was so tough! The pad Thai was overly sweet and the chicken in it was also very tough. I did not enjoy my meal at all and neither did my boyfriend. I'm pretty disappointed in the quality of the food. I don't think I could come back after this visit, which makes me sad because I like the atmosphere and the service.
First meal in Las Vegas and it was fabulous. Rolled into Vegas the night before and we went driving around and found this gem of a restaurant. Food was wonderful.

We thoroughly enjoyed our dinner from Table Thai. We were spending the night at a nearby airport hotel because of an early AM flight and did not want to go out for dinner. Everything we ordered was delicious and served to our room in less than the 45 min wait we were quoted. The food was still very warm and each dish was delicious. You can order the degree of spice you wish and we found a 2-3 out of 5 to have a bite but was not overpoweringly hot.  
We had the ShunMai which were amongst the best we've ever tasted. The pad see eiw was prepared with delicious thin, wide noodles in a gravy with broccoli ( and we added tofu). It was much lighter than many of the noddles you often get with this dish.  Finally the yellow curry was superbly flavored. 
As regular consumers of Asian food in Boston, we were totally impressed. If you are in the LV airport area, we'd highly recommend this place.
My favorite Thai spot! Great customer service and they have a handful of vegan options!
Came from Toronto for a wedding to Las Vegas. Searched up thai places close by the airport and this popped up. So I and my friends tried it and it was amazing and the price is not high at all.

I've been here several times, and it is resoundingly mediocre and overpriced.

The environment is elegant, dark, and freezing cold.

My sister and I have tasted nothing here that is above average, and the portions are small.
Almost twice as expensive as my favorite Thai places in town.

Extremely vegan friendly! This place is by far my favorite Thai restaurant in Las Vegas. 
The high level of courtesy, speed and quality of food on a consistent basis deserves my 5 stars. 
Best mango sticky rice ever!!!
Great job guys :)
My favorite waiter in all of Las Vegas works here her name is Pattie

I placed an online order, and called right away to confirm. They confirmed they received it, and I drove the 8 minutes to pick up my food. When I went to the bar, my order was already ready and bagged. Amazing service! I grabbed food to go, but I did see that all the tables were full. Such a great ambiance! Beautifully decorated. Got back to my office, and just finished my food. It was great! Definitely will be back.

Best wonton soup I have ever had. The broth was very flavorful and a little bit salty and the wontons themselves we're much better than the typical wonton. I also am a fan of the orange chicken because it actually tastes like oranges and not just a Sweet sauce. 5/5 I will return often.

Thai is always great for lunch because of the lunch specials. With that said, this place gets busy with the work lunch crowd. Price point is pretty good at under $10 with common dishes like pad thai and yellow curry ranging from $7-8. 

I can't remember the last time I had pad thai, but I have been craving it for awhile. I'm glad I was able to try this place because their pad thai is really flavorful! Is there still a lime shortage? They serve this dish with lemon instead.  The sides that come with the lunch special are salad and won ton soup, which were average. 

I sampled the yellow curry, which I was not all that impressed with. It was watered down and oily. Less flavorful than other Thai joints. 

Another disappointment was the thai tea crepe cake, which tasted nothing like thai tea. The color was the only thing that looked like thai tea. The texture was nice and overall a very light and not too sweet of a dessert. 

The interior is clean and modern with lots of natural light. Our server made us feel rushed, like trying to clear plates before we were done kind of thing. Otherwise, not too bad. Food came out quick and our waters were never empty. 

*****Yelp 2016 100 Challenge*****
46/100
The taste of the food is fresh and well prepared.  Delivery is fast and friendly.  This Thai restaurant has me coming back for more.
Absolute worst Thai food I've ever had & I love Thai food.  Got chicken yellow curry & it comes w/dark meat chicken.  You have to request white meat which is cheap.  And sauce wasn't very flavorful.

I really do like it here. The place feels very nice to have a meal in I mean the decorations and furniture make the place feel very inviting and comfortable. You can tell they did not hold back the budget to make sure people were seated very comfortably. I appreciate the touches. Now let's get to the food. 

I think that for Thai food to be priced really high you better make sure you are adding those extra touches that make you feel like you are getting your money's worth and they did great in that area as well. 

The only critique I have is again I'm sorry but when it comes to Thai food Im very picky about it so for me to give a 4 star rating means they are good enough to come back to. My fave fish was probably the crying tiger and the spicy catfish. Execution and flavor was on point. I think their pad see ew needs some work. It's too sweet. Will definitely come back to enjoy more food.

This is the best place on the east side for Thai food.  So much better than the much hailed Lotus of Siam.  REALLY good food.  Lunch specials are the best deal.  I go out of my way
to get to this place.

The delivery person was very sweet and friendly. He was probably the better part of our dinner experience. The food wasn't bad, but it wasn't special by any stretch of the imagination and for what we paid, that is a disappointment. It was about the same quality and freshness as one of the dozen Thai lunch specials around town for $8 except some of the dishes cost $15+! At these prices we were expecting really tasty, amazing Thai dishes and that just wasn't the case. We ordered a range of items including Yellow Curry, Pad Thai Thai (which was overly sweet), Fried rice, Spicy Basil Noodles, Curry puffs (as appetizer came with 5 pieces...which were very bland for a whopping $9!), and teriyaki chicken. All tasted just fine (except the curry puffs) but were simply overpriced for what we got. For this quality, I will definitely go to a cheaper place next time.

Patty was our server and she was so kind and exceptional! In fact, the entire staff was attentive and delivered great service! I ordered the Crying Tiger and Fried Wontons. Both were cooked to perfection! For my final meal, I ordered their Mango Sticky Rice which was amazing.  It's a seasonal dish, so I was lucky to order it in season. All of this and my girlfriend's meal (Pad Thai) cost less than $50!! During our time here, they had several regulars, and it's clear why!

This place is a weekly staple in my house. Service is impeccable and the food is always delicious. They have mastered the to-go process as well; always very quick and accurate. Their Pad That Thai is one of my favorites.

Went here for lunch today with some coworkers.  I was impressed with the food and excellent service for a busy lunch.  And we were most impressed with the bill; under $40 for the four of us and we left very full.  Definitely on my regular lunch stops now.
Good service and good food, was just a little diapointed with breaded catfish on "Spice Herb Catfish" that we ordered, just never had breaded catfish from a thai restaurant before.

This place just opened up recently and we have been wanting to try it. Very nice atmosphere and the staff is also very friendly. The Asia appetizer plate was beautifully presented and very tasty. We also had the panang curry and fresh ginger chicken. Try it, you'll like it.
Fast, delicious, and very affordable! Must try! Great Lunch specials! The Tofu Pad Thai is very yummy!

We been going to this place at least once a week or every other week.  On June 14th  we arrived by 11 am just after opening we were the first customers and they tried to force us to sit us down in left corner of the restaurant no room and I asked to be seated in another table with more room so they tried to force us to sit us in the right hand corner under the bar counter and I said NO,we are a regular customers We deserve better treatment, We understand that if the place is busy we get first available but not this time.  When we left there were only 8 people there .  We are not complaining about the food but the Customer service was horrible that day.

SO SO good. Great food and great portions size at a reasonable price. They also have boba which I love and vegan options which I appreciate. All of the girls who work here are super nice and my water glass was never empty. I got the Pad Thai which has chicken and shrimp and it was super tasty and my dad had the duck salad which had a nice amount of duck on it. WILL be coming back.

First Of All Wow ! This Place Is Amazing I Mean Its A Hole In The Wall With The Location But Inside Is EveryThing But A Hole In The Wall....The Food Was Great ! Its Not Very Spicy For Being At The Max Spicy Level But The Pagnang Curry Was A 10/10 And The Staff Was Very Nice Even Replaced My Food When I Droped It Over The Table Which I Tryed To Say No Its Okay But They Went Above And Beyond And Didnt Let Me Say No They Did Forget My Thai Tea I Ordered But That Just Shows There Still Humans And Not Thai Gods(Goddesses Cause I Though They Were) And In Return They Gave Us 2 Thai Teas For The Road On The House Even .....So All In All Amazing Experience From The Whole Staff....Not To Mention They Were All Super Cute And Smiley ...Specially Patty ....Deffinitly Going Back...Hope To See My Waitress/Thai Goddess Again
Very tasty, good service, hilarious grammar  I recommend the tofu towers for the appetizer and whatever curry you get, get sticky rice.

I love Table Thai! I didn't even know I liked Thai food till I came here, and now I'm hooked and come here very often. The staff is incredible and so attentive, I've never had a bad experience here and suggest Table Thai to any of my friends who want Thai food!
By far one of the best Thai food restaurants I have had in a long time. Clean and friendly staff, great flavors and worth the money! Now a loyal customer.

This was a pleasant surprise. I was on my way next door for coffee (*rise) and as I parked I thought, I'll just have a late lunch (2:30). From the outside, this place is much understated and truly unimpressive but as you enter, you immediately realize the owner put a lot of thought into making this place comfortably chic and more upscale than most Thai restaurants.  The venue is well lit, large windows with enough tinting to make it very comfortable and clean. I cannot emphasize enough how clean the place looks.  

Lunch pricing is lower than average at a great value of $7-9!!  This is only reinforced by the more than reasonable portion size.  This place reeks of great value, at least for lunch.  Considering this is my first visit and my first review of this restaurant, food-wise I would only read into this "lightly" until a couple more visits.

The food came out within 3-4 minutes of my order. Therefore, on the onset, service is awesome, the kitchen fast (perhaps too fast--I'll explain later), the staff very engaging and attentive; giving you enough space so as not to crowd the guest and are "invisible" in a positive way.  They filled my beverage (tea/water) without notice.

The disappointment - this is the gist of it. After all we go to restaurants to eat.  Therefore, if the food isn't what stands out over the ambiance, then the place is just, okay.  The brown rice was sticky and pasty; a clear sign that it was past its time in the rice cooker.  My order was as basic as it can be for a first time visit--Broccoli Chicken.  As I mentioned earlier the portion size was generous, at least 8-ounces (easily 5 oz of chicken).  The chicken was cooked well.  The vegetables, soft and over cooked.  The flavors over all were spot on; sauce was delicious.  Here is what I suspect they do in the kitchen: the base -- veggies and broth sit in a pot. They flash cook the meats (chicken, beef, pork or shrimp) per order and throw that into the base at plating.  This unfortunately makes the cooking unbalanced.  Say what you would about the P** W** chain but, theirs is cooked to order.  All of it, to order, each time.  Therefore, the veggies are not soggy and it only takes 3-4 minutes more.  I don't think anyone would balk if the kitchen takes 10-minutes to put out your lunch order. After all you can pass the time with the soup that comes with the meal anyway.  Also, the salad greens were Iceberg lettuce instead of a leafy mixed green which has more nutritional value but hey, it is under $8!! This place would better serve their customers if they par-cook the veggies or just keep the stock separately and compose the ingredients upon each order.  I'll give this place another couple of tries for dinner and perhaps with a larger group to experience it on a better day.  Every establishment is entitled to a bad day.

Went in on a late Thursday evening and it wasn't too busy. The crowd actually started to come in around 9:30pm as we were finishing up. Staff was friendly and fairly attentive. 

We ordered pad Thai, shrimp fried rice, garlic and pepper chicken, and the Crying Tiger for dinner. The shrimp in the pad Thai and fried rice were huge and had a good serving in each dish. The pad Thai was delicious! The sauce had so much flavor - you could really taste the tamarind, fish sauce, limes, etc. and they put plenty of it on the noodles so they weren't dry. Definitely a must order! The fried rice was authentic Thai style fried rice and packed so much flavor in such a simple dish. The garlic and pepper chicken was the favorite dish of the night. The sauce on it looked so simple yet the flavors were so complex. It had the sweet, the salty, a bit of spice and tang. I would eat just that sauce with a bowl of rice and be satisfied. The Crying Tiger was our let down. It's a rib eye with a kind of spicy vinegar dipping sauce. The sauce was good but the steak itself was so chewy and was cold when they brought it out to us. Wouldn't order it again. 

We also ordered a sweet roti and mango with sticky rice for dessert. The roti was perfect with a crispy exterior and soft, fluffy interior and was sweetened with just enough condensed milk. The mango and sticky rice was also good. The mango was ripe but had just a touch of tartness which matched well with the sweetened sticky rice. 

Overall, most of the meal was spectacular and we will be back again, for sure.

So we got the advertisement on our door telling us of a new Thai restaurant that open right a round the corner, so we thought we would give it a try tonight!  What  outstanding experience we had a the Table Thai Bar and Grill, the food was fresh and favorable.  We started out with the Tom Yum soup and followed up with Chicken Panang and Shrimp Pad Thia and we enjoyed our meal.  Every nice place and the servers are very nice and friendly!

We have been coming here since they opened and the food/service/cleanliness have always been consistently wonderful.  Even carry out is always top notch.  

I have found it hard to find Thai places that are consistent in their spice levels, but the folks at Table Thai always get it right.  

Some of our favorites over the years:
Pork Larb - the menu only shows chicken, which is yummy.  But you can ask for pork if you prefer.  The pork is still juicy and the larb has the right amount of lime juice.  I like that they provide lettuce leaves to eat it with.  If I had to make a negative comment, I wish they provided more lettuce leaves.
Panang curry - We have had this with pork, chicken, duck, and tofu.  I prefer it with the tofu, hubby prefers the duck, and the kids the chicken.  The curry is wonderfully rich and a perfect balance of veggies, protein, and spice.
Jade Curry - This is a lighter curry than the panang and always so tasty.  We prefer the chicken or pork but have even had it with beef.  Always a good ratio of veggies, protein, and spice.
Yellow Curry - the menu describes the dish with dark meat chicken.  Prepared that way, it is delicious with huge chunks of juicy chicken.  But you can get it with other meats, my son prefers the beef.
Crying Tiger - This is the only thing that I think the portion size is "small" on.  All the other portion sizes are big, even huge.  But this is definitely a "single" serving.  It is the only thing we have never had leftovers of.  Great spicy sauce, but they will serve it on the side if you prefer.
Stir-fried eggplant - This is one of our FAVORITE dishes.  Even my children/friends that don't like eggplant love this dish.  It is not what you might expect, because each piece of eggplant is individually battered and fried (very light delicate batter).  We always get it with tofu.  Perfect balance of sweet, spicy, salty... so yummy.
Orange Chicken - Not what you think of when you think of orange chicken.  This is not the heavy over sauced version you normally find.  Instead it is light and refreshing, but still filled with orange flavor.  
Pad Woon Sen - again, many restaurants use too much oil in this or are too heavy on the noodles vs everything else.  This is perfect flavor, ingredients, texture of the noodles.
BBQ San Set - I like this because you get a quarter chicken, sticky rice, and papaya salad.  The chicken is so flavorful and moist, and the papaya salad is a welcome light refresher.
Fresh Spring Rolls - This is the best version of spring rolls I have ever had.  Again it is about the ratios, some places put too much noodles or lettuce.  Some don't provide enough dipping sauce or it is too thick.  Most places don't put enough shrimp.  This is the perfect balance.

Other choices, hubby loves the crab rangoon.  We all like the four seasons (i think that is the name) as well as the duck wraps.  Tom Kha Ga is huge, we are always too full to eat our food when we get this.    We also like the Lad Na and the Pas See Ew but again it can get a little heavy since it has the wide noodles and it is hard to not eat it all.  

I don't think we've ever even made it to dessert because the portions are so big and the food is so tasty.
Table Thai is awesome.  My wife and I have been here a few times now and have loved it every time. Service is always quick and the food is some of the best in Henderson. We'll continue to go back.

I love Table Thai. The green curry with roti, garlic rice and tom kha soup are some of my favorite dishes. So delicious that I usually order them every time! Both the servers and delivery are super friendly and attentive. I've had all good experiences here.

This is a solid Thai restaurant located next door to Sunrise Coffee. It's small but has a clean, upscale feel. Dimly lit, it's also quiet, making it a nice place to enjoy a low key meal as my family did on a Saturday night.

We were seated immediately at a table by the door when we arrived and were given excellent service by our server for our entire meal. Contrary to many other Thai places, our server was very amiable and gave us good recommendations even assisting us with the right spice level for our food. I'm not afraid of heat and can handle just about anything. But when I ordered 3 out of 5 spice level for our food, she immediately put me in check and said I should order 2 out of 5. I'm glad I did because the spice level was just right for everyone. All of her other recommendations were solid including: recommending the barbecue chicken when they were out of the teriyaki chicken for my daughter and her friend, dark meat instead of white for our curry, and not letting us pass up on dessert.

The menu consists of your usual Thai dishes with a bonus vegan section and chef recommendation section. Our usual shrimp rolls ($8), tom yum with shrimp ($12), and yellow curry with chicken ($11) were all up to par with the curry having a more depth of flavor with other spices compared to other places. 

My daughter and her friend polished off the barbecue chicken ($10) and they gave us plenty of white rice as we needed it through our meal. I had the panang soft shell crab ($19) which the crab was fried perfectly and accompanied by some crisp asparagus and panang sauce. But there was just a little too much sauce, including on top, which drowned the crab. For dessert, everyone split the mango sticky rice ($7) which lasted about 3 minutes on the table. The tart and sweet mangoes with the sweet rice was a great finish.

We were definitely impressed with just about everything about our experience and there's no doubt we'll be back.

Really great food and service in a non-pretentious setting. Very attentive staff and the menu was great. Really enjoyed the basil pork. Sticky rice was great too. Will definitely return. Highly recommended!
The food is really good here, but the service leaves much to be desired.  I had the Tom Yum soup and it's delicious!

So heard about this place from a really close friend. Niece clean atmosphere always very kind to greet you as you walk in, promptly seating guests. Food is always good, always stick to the pasta meals. The people that work here are super friendly.
Wonderful vegan selections and very cool atmosphere. My family and I will happily return!!

I order from here all the time, The lamb panang is amazing! Best curry I've ever had.  They ran out of lamb and gave us beef, it was also delicious. Tom ka is great and we loved dipping the roki  bread in the panang. My favorite thai place besides lucki thai.

Table Thai on Sunset by the park,

We come here at least once a week now,

You have to try the mango salmon, place is very elegant, good for a quiet date, food presentation is comparable to top notch hotels in the strip

We use to drive 15 minutes to our favorite Pinkao Thai on Eastern by 215. Now we go here around the block , open late

My wife and I eat out to classy and reasonable reastaurants, this is one of our favorite place, price reasonable

Management and staff are our friends now,
I'm not sure about take out, I prefer to eat in. 

Hope to have them here forever and good luck on their restaurant

Just try it and we know you will love it, every dish is different,  just like styles of chef, you can also let them know what you want

Larry and chona

Although the service was pretty good I think the food was not 
I ordered the beef pad su ew (sorry if it's miss spelled)and the chicken lap. The presentation was nice the both dishes was way too sweet!! Noodles were and the beef tasted like it was cooked in brown sugar. I have to say that I will not be going back

This place is awesome! I went there tonight with my boyfriend and his family. We were all impressed with the quality of the food, which was all delicious and expertly prepared. We were also impressed with the service, our waitress was funny, friendly, and very attentive. I can't recommend this place strongly enough!!!

Excellent Thai food with plenty of options as far as flavor, meats, and level of spiciness. They also have vegan friendly options, more than I've seen at other Thai places. The staff are always so wonderful and greet you happily as soon as you walk in. They are so attentive and friendly, I look forward to seeing them just as much as I do going for the food! The presentation of the dishes are always so pretty and they always make sure to check on you, making sure everything is exactly to your liking. I recommend the pad si ew, the drunk noodle, curry puffs and the mango sticky rice! Can't go wrong here, delicious food and excellent staff!!

By far. The best Thai restaurant I've been to/eaten at/had food delivered from. The staff is amazing and friendly! Some of the best curry I've ever had has been here. Green, red, and panang have been the ones i've tried and have enjoyed tremendously. Asking for extra veggies has been my favorite additional item for these particular dishes. My friend and I love this little gem. They have varieties of milk to accommodate those with restrictions or preferences. I specially love having my thai tea with coconut milk! Yummy. There has not been an item I have not liked so far. Centrally located as far as the city limits are concerned and even if it is not for you, the rewards for dining or ordering from here will absolutely make it worth it. Thank you TTBB! You guys rock!

I was in the mood for Thai and instead of going to my usual Thai spot around the corner from my house I yelped and found this place and wow I'm glad I did! 

This place is small, clean and chic. The service was excellent and the chef here knows what he is doing. My compliments to the chef! 

We had the lunch special, which starts at $7! Great prices and amazingly delicious food! 

They also have a vegan menu. This place is well deserving of their great reviews. I am definitely coming back here. 

And I know this is going to sound really weird, but this place has really comfortable seating!! I didn't want to get up from my chair.

EASY 5 stars. 

*Atmosphere- The restaurant itself has a great relaxing atmosphere. The chair you sit on, your table, and the decorations are all top of the line. They don't cut any corners.

*Service- Flawless. The waitresses are all dressed in classy matching outfits, super friendly and very attentive. We were there when it was busy too.

*Food- My massaman curry was amazing. Good portion size, great presentation and perfectly cooked. My Thai girlfriend loves pad see eiw and is kind of a snob when it comes to her thai food.  She says it is the best she's ever had. Also, the thai ice coffee was delicious.

It was a great choice for Valentine's and we'll definitely be back.
What an unexpected jewel. The service was very friendly and fast. Food was amazing. We were new to Thai Food and the staff really made the visit fun. Can't miss with this beautiful place.

4 stars for my first visit.  The next may boost my option to 5!  Much better than we expected for a quick lunch stop.  Each dish was excellent and the soup was too.
The service was good and the furnishings were a pleasant surprise.  Don't let the strip mall type location fool you.  This place is great for Thai

Amazing food! always happy to come back here. Its friendly clean and comfy. 
Food was plated beautify as well. Beef salad is my favorite thing on the menu so far.

Fantastic. I had their salmon with mango. Delicious m their soup was also  great. I could taste all of the ingredients in there, especially the green peas. Service was great and the place is clean and well decorated. 5 stars.

The thai food is definitely legit if you're in this side of town but the five stars come from the absolute stellar service.they were amazingly friendly, helpful and the service alone made me want to come back.

Table Thai is very inviting. The atmosphere is pleasant, it is clean, and the food is delicious. A centerpiece of this establishment is Patty (unsure of how she spells her name.) She seems to thrive on serving and making everyone happy. She was zipping around from table to table, and I wish I knew what vitamins she took (ha ha). 

Being my first time here and assuming they would get the order to the right table, I didn't pay attention (my fault) to what I was served, although a different server announced what it was as she brought it to the table. When I asked after a few scrumptuous bites if a spicy shrimp salad came with the salmon I had ordered, it was discovered that it belonged to the nice couple at the next table. I was told to keep the salad anyway no charge. Patty made sure the couple got extras to compensate for the wait, and the wife told me that Patty is always like that. When I had to have my leftovers boxed, Patty gave me fresh rice and a yummy, and as she pointed out, healthy Thai Tea to replace the regular iced tea I didn't get to finish. My order of Garlic Salmon was so yummy I will order it again (if you don't mind it being sweet, try it.) But I also want to try other items on their menu. This place is a little out of the way for me, but, believe me, I will make it "on the way!" Also, they offer brown rice!
Fell in love with this restaurant when my mom showed it to me! Great staff, relaxed atmosphere, and even better food. Plenty of options for vegans/vegetarians as well!

I used to eat here all the time until one time me and my boyfriend got sick and were pretty sure it was from something we ate there based off of the time period. However we were not positive, but it was enough to keep us from coming back. So tonight I was in the area and felt like pad Thai. I decided to give table thai another shot...I was initially shocked when I was charged 12.99 for vegetable pad Thai Togo. I would have never ordered it had I known it was going to be so expensive...by time I saw the price it was too late because I had called in to order Togo and they never told me my total before we hung up. I suppose that's my fault for not asking...I left a $2 tip because I am in the service industry and everyone who works here is super nice. So the vegetable pad Thai was pretty bad...it smelt and tasted like fish and they gave me lemons rather then the limes I had requested. I couldn't even finish it, so I gave the rest to my mom.  Without me even saying anything about the fishy odor and taste my mom mentioned how it smelt and tasted like fish. She thought there was fish in it. Now that to me is pretty gross. For the price and quality I won't be coming back again.

NOTE: after checking the menu just now I have noticed the pad Thai is only $10...still over priced for bad food, but I will be calling and demanding to be refunded and charged the correct price. I'll never come here again. Done.

After the harsh criticism I read about the Orange chicken and sweet and sour chicken from fellow yelpers, I was appalled and had to come reconfirm right away! Sure no Asian restaurant can serve sub par orange chicken, that's absurd. 

Upon arriving at the restaurant, I realized it was called Thai Table, and not Panda Express. Oddly enough, I didn't try the Orange chicken for the mere fact that this was an actual Asian restaurant. 

I was overall impressed with the food, but since I did not get the Orange chicken though, I don't think I can fairly critique this restaurant.

My wife and I have ordered from this place several times and it never disappoints. The food is always good. It's weird but I really like the wonton soup which is was not expected. I highly recommend this place.

I ordered delivery and it wa just "ok". I ordered the shu mai which was amazingly seasoned and that plum sauce was a great compliment to them. The yellow I curry I ordered just wasn't that great and I've tasted my fair share of Thai curries. It was sweeter in taste and although I asked for it to be pretty aggressively spiced it wasn't. Also, most yellow curries that I've had have carrots, onion, potato, and meat. This one was missing onion? I'd be willing to give them another chance, but for now unfortunately this is my stance.

This is basically a 3.5 star experience; I'll round down instead of up because I think they are a little overrated on Yelp atm.

I had the lunch with the salmon jade curry, which is basically a yellow curry with salmon in it. The dish came with a soup of some fairly uninspired veggies (pretty sure they came out of a frozen package). The main entree was solid, if overall unspectacular. Spice level was about right. The amount of salmon in the dish is not stingy, though I do think it is farm raised salmon. There were also some veggies in the dish. Overall I think it might have been a little overpriced but not too much. Not the best Thai food in town, not the worst. I would return, but I don't think I'd seek it out.

We came for lunch, the atmosphere was great and the service was also wonderful.  The food was really laking flavor, I got the chicken pad thai and my husband got the green curry salmon.  My pad thai needed salt and the salmon was definitely frozen fish.  We also ordered egg rolls which had great crunch but the inside was mush, no texture.  The service would bring me back but the food is forgettable.
This place is amazing. Best thai food in Vegas. And..AND...vegan options.  You will not be sorry if you really love thai food.

4.5 stars is my rating because this was the best Pad See Ew I've had in Vegas! Dropped in on a Saturday night around 7pm. Wasn't too busy, they have about 12 tables inside a beautifully decorated small restaurant. Nice soft chairs to sit in. They do serve alcohol now, I saw several asian beers available and some sake as well. 

Service was excellent. I believe the owner seated me and took my order. Very nice lady. The food was excellent as well, I ordered my standard crab rangoon appetizer, and Pork Pad See Ew. The crab rangoon had a really good orange citrus sauce that looked homemade and not from a jar. Excellent taste!

The pork pad see ew was also delicious, cooked well and the stir fry sauce wasn't too sweet as I've had other places. Complimented the flavors of the pork, noodles, and egg instead of overpowering it. Like I said, it was the best I've had in Vegas and I've eaten at a lot of Thai places.

I'll be back again and again because the food really is good, the menu is fairly extensive with many options including some Japanese and Chinese options.

In town for business, and was looking for a casual and comfortable place to have a late-ish dinner that's not too expensive. Glad to have stumbled across this restaurant. The atmosphere was relaxed and the decor was modern and clean. I was the only patron around 9:30pm on a weeknight and the staff was respectful and attentive. 

Here's what I tried:
*Small chicken, shrimp and wonton soup, $6.00: really tasty but sliiiiiiightly too salty. Good enough to order again. 
*Red curry with shrimp and (sweet potatoes?), level 5 spicy, $15:00: Really tasty with fresh ingredients. They made it "very spicy" as I requested, and still managed to keep it super flavorful.

I'd love to dine here again and try other dishes. Totally recommend!

Really nice staff. Great menu. They serve beer and wine and it's nice and relaxing in here.  My favorite. They even do delivery with $15 minimum and it's not that are from my house. Which I love. Just tried Thai iced tea for the first time with half and half. It's amazing and makes you feel fresh on this very hot day.  And for dessert my favorite also. Sticky rice and mangos. Guess I have a lot of favorites lol!

This place is pretty new, at least to me. It's a little far from my house in 7 Hills and was cautious about trying a new Thai resturant. I was very happy I did! Had the papaya salad and was spiced perfectly. The the dancing shrimp and loved it. They have made me a regular.

I think I've tried every reputable Thai Restaurant in Henderson by now.

Table Thai takes the #1 slot for me. Everything is absolutely delicious and their selection of Vegan options is massive. Make it during lunch time and be treated to soup, salad, and the main course for a very affordable price. 

My favorite Thai dish is yellow curry. Wow it's just so good here, perfect thickness of the sauce and the most fresh ingredients. Let me also say the peanut and ginger dressings here are easily the best I've ever had. I also love how the serve the soup first, it really opens the palate. 

Shout out to the servers and cooks here. They are so friendly and really make the experience better.
Delicious spicy thai food with unique flavors. And the service was great! Enjoyed the pad kee mow and dumplings. And the tofu appetizers

After a long day at the iheartradio music festival this lil Thai place was the culinary happiness of our time in Vegas. The owner was sweet and helpful with the menu. Our waters were constantly refilled by another server. They didn't miss a beat. I got the pineapple shrimp curry with a level 3 spice....it was beyond perfect the spice and the fresh veggies made my mouth happy. My boyfriend ordered an asparagus dish with mushrooms and shrimp. I tried his and the flavors were wonderful, very bright. For a Thai place it is delish and prices well!! Try it out for sure!

Wow, so good! We tried 5 vegan dishes and they were ALL Awesome! Our friends ordered a fish and a chicken dish - they loved them too! The service was excellent! I'm so happy we found the best Thai food in Vegas + they have Amazon Delivery!

Dancing Shrimp Salad, Shumai, Tom Ka Gai soup! We also had pineapple chicken fried rice and Thai iced tea!

Thai food is my favorite and I choose Thai wherever I travel. After doing my Yelp research, we traveled over 5 miles by Uber each way to go to this restaurant and it did not disappoint!

The food was fabulous!!! I never had Shumai before! A new favorite. The Tom Ka Gai was the best I've ever had! And the chicken pineapple fried rice, they took it to a whole new level!!! 

Thai Iced Tea was great as always. Always too sweet.

My biggest disappointment was that we didn't have room for the sticky mango rice dessert!

Service was fantastic! Warm and attentive, clearly committed to excellence while treating you like family!

Two thumbs up!!

I had a late-night craving for Thai food and this was the only place open late enough to deliver. The food wasn't terrible, but it wasn't my favorite either.

The Chicken Satay was pretty bland, and the peanut sauce wasn't as creamy as I normally see at other restaurants. It was very oily and the ingredients were separating in the container. I had to stir it up before every bite.

The Fresh Roll with Shrimp was very messy and hard to eat. It was falling apart more and more with every bite. The rice paper was ripping before I even picked it up. 

The Beef Pho did not have the traditional thin Vermicelli noodles that I was expecting. Instead the noodles were wider and flatter, and the broth had a sweet taste to it. 

Like I said, the food wasn't terrible, it just wasn't what I was expecting and didn't really satisfy my craving.

This place is great and I love the Vegan options. Ordered takeout several times and I am always satisfied.  Awesome location, very clean, super friendly...can't wait to dine in sometime.  Def a place to check out!!!!

Very good authentic thai restaurant. They also have a good selection of Vegetarian meals. I tried their Roti and it was great, the pad thai noodles is among the best I ever had. The quality of the noodles is good and cooked just right. If you are in for soup you should try the Tom Kha.

Very friendly staff and good service. Well worth the 35 minutes travel from my place and I know I will be back.

I went in again and unfortunately, the quality of food wasn't as great as my first experience.

I had the Pad Thai Lunch Plate with Shrimp and unfortunately, it was too sweet and soggy. It definitely didn't taste like the Pad Thai dishes I've had a other restaurants. If I come here again, I'd probably stick to Pad Sew Ew. My partner got the Massaman Curry, which tasted decent.

As for appetizers, we decided to go with the Duck Rolls again and it was a disappointment. I felt like the veggies this time were a little overpowering compared to the duck meat, so I had to say "No" to this dish too. I loved it last time too, so it must have been a bad batch or something.

Service was great still as they constantly checked on us and refilled our waters. For a table of 3, we spent about $42ish with tax and tip. We went during lunch too and were quickly seated within seconds.
Wow! I got the red curry,  lunch special at that and it was a large portion.  It was absolutely delicious, the service was impeccable and I'll be back very soon.

I've tried this place through UberEats and was pleasantly surprised. 

I ordered the pad see ew and the noodles were pretty good. Good portion and the price was in par with other Thai joints in town. There was plenty leftover for lunch the next day which is always a plus.
